campaign.story:
A cozy open world RPG where you’ll meet lovable quirky characters, live amongst them as a member of the community, and help guide them through the dark and desperate times that await them.
 Demo! | Discord |  YouTube | Twitter 
  Find and Tame pets that follow you on your adventure. Bond with them, keep them happy, and they'll love you in return.
 Meet Villagers and build lasting relationships. Some may even become party members that fight by your side.
 Explore the magical world of Emora. Throughout your journey you'll encounter giant mushroom caverns, enchanted woods, the nightmarish realm of a sleeping god and more.
 Cast powerful spells. Summon your own skelly minion to fight with you or protect yourself with an ethereal magic armor.
 Decorate and upgrade your home. Place items like chests for storing your loot, a kettle for cooking, or just a nice rug to spruce the place up a bit.
 A tyrannical god once ruled over It’s creation in a reign of fear and oppression. One day the people rebelled and a group of mages banded together to seal It away. Although the scars from this era are still fresh, the people have started to move on and are finally beginning to prosper in a new age.
But It has begun to stir in Its sleep, and the veil between this world and an all too familiar nightmare is shredding into pieces as the Demon God's dream blends into reality.
Zoe and the Cursed Dreamer already has a reputation for lovable quirky characters. Here are just a few of the more important ones so far.
 Teddy: The lovable butcher with a secret. He was relentlessly bullied as a child for his love of baking, and became the town’s butcher so that he would be seen as manly. He hates his job and aspires to be the town’s baker, but he does his cooking in secret. You can help make his dream come true.
 Claire: Your childhood best friend. You haven’t seen her since you left the village many years ago, but she still has fond memories of the time spent together with you. She was an orphaned child, never knowing who her parents were. She has adopted a young girl that recently lost her parents, ensuring she is well loved and safe.
 Sue: The village blacksmith and Teddy’s older sister. She’s a strong woman that carries her massive hammer everywhere she goes. Despite her size though, she’s a soft-spoken introvert with a heart of gold.
 Mad Catter: A mysterious and whimsical cat. Not much is known about this curious creature other than he’s very old and extremely powerful. He loves taking naps, subtle humor, and 6th wall breaks.
Zoe and the Cursed Dreamer is about experiencing a world and being immersed in it. Throughout your journey, you’ll be able to enjoy relaxing optional tasks that enhance your gameplay. Some of these are already implemented, while others are planned for the future.
 Collect bugs like common butterflies in the forest or rare beetles deep underground.
Seek out fishing spots and cast your rod to see what you can catch. But beware, skellies will sometimes go boney dipping.
Planned Features:
Mine rare ores and minerals to craft into unique weapons and armor.
 Food keeps you happy and healthy. Cook your food into meals to increase their benefits and unlock extra buffs.
 Gather food from the wild or plant the seeds and start a farm. Higher quality foods will provide greater benefits when cooked.
  Howdy! I’m a solo developer who is finally creating my childhood dream game! I’ve been developing the story of this game for over 18 years, and I’m thrilled to see it come to life. It started out as a novel that I wanted to write, and when I took an interest in game development it became a game that I wanted to create.

This project has a lot of sentimental value for me, so I will be creating everything myself, including the art, music, code, and anything in between. It’s a lot of hats to wear, but I love learning new skills, so I’ve been having the time of my life working on this project.
I host the YouTube channel Game Endeavor where I post devlogs and livestream the design process. So if you want to see how the game has developed as far back as day one, then go watch the devlog series on YouTube. This is my most popular devlog with over 400,000 views!

 50,000+ YouTube subscribers
 1.3+ million video views
 5,000+ Discord community members
 10+ years of programming experience
 Target Platforms
These major PC platforms will be supported:
Windows, Linux, Mac
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I've been developing this project for nine months, and I believe most of the hard work is behind me. The hardest part was getting the combat system, ai that fights with you, and complex cutscenes working. I did those early because I knew they would be a bit difficult.

There is still the multiplayer system that I would like to implement, which is primarily why I've given myself such an extended time period to release this project, just to have some breathing room. 

Should I need to adjust my time schedule or make significant changes to the game, I am open about it not only with my backers but also my community.

campaign.story:
Mockup of how the final book will look
Mockup of A4 Hardback edition
Mockup of the special Colostle themed deck of cards - (final artwork will change)
Colostle, an impossibly massive castle, the interior of which is so large that mountains, valleys, towns, cities and even oceans fill its rooms, with the ceilings and roof so high they are beyond sight, shrouded by the misty expanse of the sky, that sits within it’s vaulted heights.
There seems to be no finding the exterior of the castle with many adventurers setting out with that as their goal. Instead, crossing continental distances, only to reach the wall of a ‘room’. Passing beyond will only bring yet another room on the other side of it, with new lands stretching off just as far again.
Although all manner of threats exist out in the wilds, such as strange animals and beasts, and other barbaric or dangerous people, the greatest dangers of all, are the Rooks. Huge, hulking stone automatons that patrol, somewhat mindlessly, out in the wilds of the Colostle’s rooms.
That is until they are disturbed. Every Rook is different, there are no two the same, and they are the only source of magic in the world. As such, they are something of a target to hunters looking for tech they can scavenge, artefacts they can sell or magic crystals to grant them strange and unpredictable powers.
That is if they can bring one down...
A 'room' stretching out before an Armed adventurer...
What is a solo RPG?
Think of it like a personal, mindful writing exercise, where the game provides you with prompts to write your own fascinating adventure in this strange world. You will be keeping a journal of your adventures, and the game system is a way to determine what you will encounter along the way, and to dictate the outcome of combat. All the book provides is prompts and inspirations, but it is up to you and your character to flesh out the details and to write about what you discover.
First you need to create a character, someone of this world. This book will guide you through this process, but it is completely up to you. Then the game provides you with an outline of your first adventure. You can decide how to interpret these prompts and what to write, there are no limits to what you can do, this is YOUR adventure.

What is in the book?
The Colostle book will be a 24 page A5 tome with all the rules required to create and play your own Colostle adventure. The book will have a thick 300gsm cover with foiled lettering, and the internal pages will be on off-white recycled paper for an otherworldly look and feel. The book will also feature black and white illustrations throughout suggesting glimpses of the world and the kind of characters you could create.
Design of the interior black and white pages (mockup)
How does the game work?
The basic principle is that of drawing cards from a shuffled deck of playing cards, and checking their colour, suit or number against tables to see what they represent for your adventure.
In the exploration phase of the game cards might stand for meeting another traveller on your journey, finding some abandoned ruins or discovering a mysterious doorway. its up to you to write in your journal what these things are and what they mean for your character. The game simply suggests things, like writing prompts, set against a fantastical world... its up to you what they all mean for your greater story. In the Combat phase, cards stand for attacks with the numbers on the cards showing their strength. Playing the right card at the right time could mean victory for your character!
As you play and write you will find ideas for what the mysteries of the Colostle might mean, just falling into your head. I don't provide the answers in the book, every player will discover their own truth and meaning of the world.
All you will need is a deck of playing cards, a pen, some rough paper for making gameplay notes and a journal to record your character's adventures in.
How to Play Colostle - Example of a typical Exploration and Combat phase in the game
3 Unique Character classes
To play Colostle you will need to create a character, and to that end there are 3 unique classes introduced in the book that will help you do that. They are; The Armed, The Followed and The Helmed. All of them use parts and pieces harvested from Rooks that give them special abilities. I don't want to give everything away, as it is only a small book (!) but you can see an Illustration of The Armed class below.
The Armed - wielders of harvested Rook arms
 Rewards + Stretch Goals Breakdown
 Cheaper Shipping Options
If you look in the rewards you will notice that some rewards have an identical twin with the added 'Cheaper Shipping' to their title. This is because I found a cheaper shipping cost later in the life of the campaign after these tiers had been already added. If you are a new backer, and you live outside the UK, please make sure you select the 'Cheaper Shipping' version of the tier you would like, to make sure you get the best deal on your shipping.
(These 'Cheaper Shipping' options only exist for the top 3 tiers, £20 or over. The lower tiers have accurate international shipping as they are, so you don't need to worry about those)
New artwork for the 'Oceans' module!
New artwork for the 'Battlements' module
Who am I?
My name is Nich Angell and I am a comic book artist, illustrator, writer and game designer. I am one quarter of the stories-and-games company Big Punch Studios, creators of comics such as 7STRING, Afterlife Inc., and Cat and Meringue and the super fun card game Sandwich Masters!
I have worked on a lot of comics and games, both from an illustrator perspective and a concept/creation one. More than anything I love creating worlds, whether thats a place to hear a story from, or a place to play a game in, making worlds is my thing! So when I found out about solo RPGs and played a few I realised what an awesome thing they were, a small tight rulebook for a brand new world.
As someone with a wild imagination I am always coming up with new ideas and Colostle is the latest setting that popped into my head. This time though, I was excited to create a more open ended world so that others can experience the joy I have creating stories, adventures and mysteries.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I have worked on many graphic novels and as such am extremely familiar with creating books and making artwork printready. I have run a great many Kickstarters both on my own and as part of Big Punch so I am highly confident in the process and know the extent of what is involved.

As with all of my Kickstarters and those I have been a part of, I believe communication is key. I know to update regularly and keep the backers informed even if unforeseen delays or problems occur.

With a small book and a small print run like this I don't foresee any issues. The kinds of things might be print delays, quality issues, and delivery but I have plans for all of these issues if and when they appear.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
campaign.env:
Environmental commitments
Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Reusability and recyclability
The book will not be packaged in any plastic shrinkwrap or film, and will be delivered in a fully recyclable cardboard book envelope. The book itself as it is all card and paper is fully recyclable too.
Sustainable materials
All the interior pages of this book are printed on recycled paper.
Environmentally friendly factories
The printers I have selected for this project put the environment first. They have reduced their use of solvents and other hazardous waste down to almost zero, reduced their setup waste to almost zero and recycle every offcut created during the manufacturing process.
Sustainable Distribution
The printer I use are UK based which means any UK orders will not involve costly international bulk shipping. Any international orders will be shipped via the most sustainable package delivery service I can find at the time of sending.

Roomlanders!
Sorry its been a bit quiet from me lately! This is only because everything is going so smoothly and I have nothing specific to report! That said, I do want to keep you all up to date with everything there is to know, so I thought I'd come on here with another state-of-play update.
First up, my house is full of boxes of these:

Roomlanders!
The game is out there in the world and the feedback has been amazing! Thank you for all your positivity, good vibes and enjoyment! And a few of you have posted some of your journals of your adventures and they are all without exception, EXCELLENT. I LOVE reading about what your characters are getting up to out there in the Roomlands and some of the ideas you guys are coming up with completely separate of my prompts are stunning. Really impressed. Thank you for really getting into this and making it such a fun community, you guys really are the best!
DISCORD

updates.update_content:
Roomlanders!
We're finally at the point where I can share the first Colostle rewards with you all! This is super nerve-wracking for me, but I'm also very excited. Its nerve-wracking because this thing started life as such a small project and thanks to all of you it has grown so much. It's my first venture into creating a solo RPG and I really hope it meets all of your expectations!
It represents my first step, and if you guys like it I have so many ideas for future settings, worlds and mechanics we can take this to, so this is something of a very exciting first step!

updates.update_userinfo: CHARGING CARDS and DIGITAL COPIES and BREAD ROLES!
updates.update_content:
Hey Roomlanders,
Hope you are all doing well. Sorry its been a little while since my last update, I've been going through some sad family stuff these last couple of weeks and it's distracted me a little, but I'm back and i'm focused on getting Colostle out to you as soon as possible.
Production has started on all elements but due to a very busy schedule for my Hardback printer/binder, the hardbacks won't be delivered to me until the week commencing 5th of July. Unfortunately this means everything else will be delayed by that date, as I have to send everything all together to the fulfilment company. This means the earliest you guys will probably be receiving your rewards is late July.

Roomlanders!
I am very close now to hitting the final button on the final artwork for the books and sending them off to print! Just got some hefty proof-reading and rules-reading and spell-checking left to do and then we're good. Who knew a book like this would need so many semi-colons and I would miss them all!
The cards and journals are already in production with their respective printers and the Hardback book is built, and boy howdy is it a good looking book! I'm very proud of it! They should be going over to printers today or tomorrow and then we'll be in production!

Hey Roomlanders!
Just a quick one from me to remind everyone that the Surveys and Pre-orders will lock tomorrow which means you will no longer be able to tweak your order and add or remove any add-ons you want. This also means if you still haven't yet completed your survey, you will not be able to add anything to your base pledge when you come to do it.
With some final work this weekend, all of the work on the game will be complete and I will be sending everything off to production! I will then let you know exactly when you can expect to receive the digital rewards!

Hey Roomlanders!
I am looking to lock surveys and pre-orders on the 30th of April, so that I can begin production on the various elements. This means:
1. If you have already completed your survey but are considering maybe adding another add-on or two, now is the time to do it. You won't be able to add anything to your pledge once the surveys are locked.

Hey Roomlanders,
Quick update from me just to let you know that work is progressing nicely. All the rules are now written, and laid out in the book layouts. This means that all that is left is all the illustrations to fill in all the various gaps in the book layouts and the cards! I have a master list for all remaining illustrations and there are only 16 left todo!

updates.update_userinfo: Response to previous update - and more artwork!!
updates.update_content:
Wow, what a response! Thanks so much for all your feedback guys! It really is awesome how I can chuck an idea out and hear back from so many of you on what you think, it really helps too so I super appreciate it.
There were a lot of different responses from everyone but quite a few common themes kept cropping up so I want to address those with some guarantees and promises from me.
Firstly, this was just an idea. I put it out to you all to see what you thought of it, and for you to give your feedback on. It is not something I am starting now, or intending to start anytime soon. I only brought it up this early so that I had plenty of time for various planning and feedback, if you liked the sound of it.

campaign.story:
Important notice: The delivery of the printed deck will be delayed to January or even February 2021 due to unexpected high interest, winter holidays and a non responsive manufacturer. Read more about it in the update #5

Have you ever had the problem of needing to describe a dungeon and none of the players could really imagine how the structure is actually built? You don't always have to draw a battle map. Sometimes a small picture is enough to quickly show what the situation around the players looks like. Or did you ever try to come up with a dungeon room on the fly and just could not come up with an interesting layout? This deck of dungeon cards is perfect for those situations. 36 (now 54) unique cards full of stairs, dark corners, slim corridors, claustrophobic rooms, crates, barrels and much more to place monsters and treasure in.
Cards can be either used separately or combined to form larger dungeons. You can reveal one card after another as your players make their way through the dungeon and make them curious about each corner.
The cards are made out of professional 310gsm card stock with a blue core and smooth linen finish for the professional look & feel. The deck comes in a custom printed tuck box with a protective matte coating to give your cards the home they deserve. 
Speaking of... Each map (as well as the back of the card and the box) is completely hand-drawn. All 36 cards are already done and just need to be sent off to the printer.
So why Kickstarter? This is a test for me to see if such a deck is even wanted by enough people. If this project gets funded I can let the cards print for a reasonable price per deck without making a loss or charging an impossible high price.
Support Tiers
5€ - Get the PDF
You will get the full Deck of Dungeons (including the back side) as a PDF. This is perfect for those that would like to support this project but can't (or don't want to) afford the price of the physical deck + shipping costs.
15€ - Get the printed deck
You will get the physical Deck of Dungeons. Perfect for Dungeon Masters, as a present or just as a collectors item.
18€ - Physical & digital deck
Get both - The PDF and the printed deck. This is for people who play classically as well as digitally or want to collect the printed deck and use the digital one.
If you want more than one deck please contact me with the shipping country. I would need to calculate the additional costs depending on where to ship. Thank you for your understanding :)
Stretch Goals
I am very hesitant when it comes to stretch goals for this project. This is my first kickstarter and I just want everyone to get what they expect and as smoothly as possible. But if the project gets a lot more supporters than expected, I probably have no choice. So here is the goal:
[Unlocked] 300 Supporters - 54 Cards
If we hit 300 or more supporters I will increase the number of cards in this deck to 54. It doesn't matter if for the physical deck or the PDF version. If we reach 300 backers the deal is sealed. I will invest some extra time to come up with 18 additional cards.
So if you would like to have a thicker deck make sure to share this project and encourage your friends to grab a copy as well ;)
 Shipping
The Deck of Dungeon gets shipped worldwide. The shipping costs will be added after you selected your pledge level. 
Germany: 6 €
Rest of the EU, USA, Canada, Japan: 11 €
Rest of the world: 13 €
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Even though this is my first kickstarter I am fairly confident that everything will go smoothly. The designs for the deck and tuck box are done and I already got several prototype prints of the deck from the printer to check the quality and made some adjustments.

Of course it is always possible that something goes wrong during each step of the process and the shipping could get delayed. But I will try everything possible to avoid those problems and keep you updated on each and every step.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hurray! 🎉 The first batch of shipments went out today. It's not the majority of packages but it's already a good start with countries all over the world.  Don't worry if you didn't get your tracking code today. The Fulfilment center needs a bit to pack and send out all ~1500 packages.
Okay, all fine and good. But when will you actually hold the Decks in your hands?
If you live in Germany you can expect the shipment to arrive within a couple of days after you received the tracking code. A few days more if you live within the EU. But for other countries (continents) it might take longer. Due to the ongoing pandemic packages get shipped via cargo ships instead of planes to the whole of America for example. I am not sure how it is with Asia or Australia but I expect the same.  I really chose the wrong year for this project 😅

Hello everyone!
I have good news. The Decks have been delivered to the Fulfilment center and are almost ready to ship. 😉
Unfortunately I need to clean up the exported addresses. The fulfilment center needs them in a very specific form which can not be provided by the Kickstarter export. For example street and house number need to be in separate fields, phone numbers shouldn't have special characters, names should be first & last name... Checking and fixing all this might take me another day or two. I will make sure to get it done as fast as possible.

Greetings!
I said I would close the surveys on the 20th. But my day job demanded a lot of extra attention the last days so I forgot to give another notice. But now for real. I will close the surveys in around 24 hours. So this is your last chance to fill it in if you didn't do it already and get the Decks as soon as possible. 😉

updates.update_content:
Everything has shipped (almost) - now I'm just sorting through the couple oddball leftovers, like address errors, missing stuff etc. The majority of you should have something on its way if it hasn't already delivered. Check your Backerkit log-in for tracking info.

My sincere appologies for the optimistic delivery date. I've never seen anything like this. In the past when I have a shipment with a lot of pieces they always arrive together (and in about 3 days with air-freight). These shipped late October and there's still one box that hasn't arrived. I think it's lost, UPS isn't able to tell me much.

Hey y'all! It's been the weirdest thing, UPS is giving me the shipment a box or two at a time. In the past with air freight I have them in 3 days - it's been about 35 days.  I still don't have them all yet but I'm going to start shipping the orders I can. So some of you will start receiving yours next week. Backerkit doesn't automatically send you shipping information so you'll need to check your survey. You should be able to go to the Backerkit link you got to fill out your survey and see the status of your order. If it has shipped you'll see the tracking number. Sorry, I wish Backerkit automatically sent them out but they don't.

So, 
I've been watching the same tracking number all month and I was so excited to see it was out for delivery. I have 29 cartons coming and we were ready to receive them and ship them out to you. I even wrote an update with the good news but decided to wait to post it. I watched all day and then a little unmarked mini van pulled up and a lady got out with one box. I asked about the other 28 and she was like, uh.... She called her supervisor and then they called around. Apparently they're in LA and they just shipped one. Huh? The freight company assures me they are not lost but just delayed because UPS is so swamped.

Just a quick update... The shipment has been in customs since the 13th. I wanted to wait until it was released to give you some good news but I didn't want to leave you hanging too long. So... I'm hoping it'll be released any day now and then it'll arrive here a day or two later. I'm only a few hours from LA so it won't take long. The lesson learned here is don't make any shipping promises anywhere close to Black Friday because all freight and customs are going to be busy. The good news is we're ready to ship them, I have all the shipping supplies ready to just add the rewards and drop in the mail.  Keep your fingers crossed!

Hey y'all! Good news, the factory has shipped them to me. The bad news is (because of everyone's rush to get products for black Friday) instead of the normal 3 days shipping it will take 15 days :-(  That's my fastest shipping option.
So... we missed the October target date. But they're done and on there way. Stay tuned!

Hey everyone, just checking in. The factory is wrapping up and should be ready to ship everything out on the 26th. I should have them about three days later and will be ready to start shipping them to you. This is completely insane that the Kickstarter ended two weeks ago and your rewards are almost ready to ship out. 

I'll let you know when I get them and what to expect as far as shipping goes. After they ship, you can log into Backerkit to get your tracking number.

Surveys have started. Backerkit requires me to send out only 5% of the surveys first to troubleshoot any potential problems. So 5% of you will get your survey today. If those go well, the rest will go out shortly after.

Add ons! Please note that add-ons are available for backers at Kickstarter prices. Others will not be getting these deals. Also note that we are sold out of the original size blank sketchbooks on our web store so you are getting first dibs on the small amount of stock I'm getting in. Once those are gone the next batch won't be in until the end of November.

Thank you everyone!
You made it happen. Yesterday I couldn't do anything except stare at the screen all day. I'd take breaks and go for walks or work on other stuff but I kept coming back to the screen. For a while there it kept teetering back and forth on $22,000. Someone would pledge and it would hit $22, 000, we'd celebrate and then someone would cancel and it would go back to 21something. We did that cycle a couple times towards the end. Don't get me wrong, I was happy with $21something but when we were just $1 shy if $22,000 your OCD kicks in. It can't stay at $21,999. It's like pumping gas and it stops at $19.99. You know you have to squeeze another penny in, you can't leave it like that.

campaign.story:
Illustrators. Stop Starving. Start Thriving. 
Discover how you can turn your art skills into your own thriving career in Illustration. 
FACT: Being an Illustrator is tough!
You have hopes and dreams to make it big as an artist; but you don't know how to make it happen. Still, you push along doing the best that you can. Yet, as you move forward you can't help but feel stress & anxiety about the future. "Will I actually succeed with my art?" "Is it even possible to find an art career that will pay my bills and  fulfill me creatively?" To make things worse, you sometimes cave into your fears because of social distancing and/or your past.
Well, listen up! If you want to earn a solid living with your art skills, if you want to be recognized for your brand/content, or if you simply want to land your dream art job, then you need to read what I'm going to say...


Stop doubting! Your successful career in illustration is possible. I've written a guide to help you make it happen. 
These may be BOLD words from a stranger - Why can I make you this promise?


My name is Will Terry and I am a successful  illustrator. - I’ve illustrated over 30 children’s books for publishers like Scholastic, Penguin Random House, and Simon Schuster. I co-founded the wildly popular illustration podcast - 3 point perspective. I co-founded SVSLEARN.com with Jake Parker and Lee White where we teach illustrators all over the world. I’ve created a thriving comic convention brand. I taught illustration and business practices for 9 years at UVU. I’ve been giving entrepreneurial advice on my popular YouTube channel  for over 10 years!
The point is, I've made my own successful illustration career. I, along with 12 other award winning illustrators, will show you how to make yours.

 What They Don't Teach You In Art School is a guide to help you create new opportunities using your art skills to pay the bills, even if you have no prospects right now. 
In this BEAUTIFUL 300-page fully illustrated hard cover book; you're going to learn:
Industry Insights
You will learn the most relevant professional practices I use in my career to this date. To name a few: How to find clients, how to price effectively and close deals, how to figure out which industry your art is best suited for, how to correctly invoice, industry mistakes you should avoid, and more...
This means you will be fully prepared to find and secure the right opportunities that will fulfill you creatively and pay you fairly.

How To Land Your Dream Art Job
For some of you, landing that nice prestigious illustration job at a famous company like Disney, Riot games, or DreamWorks is your dream. In this guide you will learn how to network effectively, how to get yourself & your art noticed, how to nail an interview, and much more.
This means that you will have a competitive edge over all the other illustrators out there trying to get the top jobs in your industry.

How To Get Freelance Work
For those of you looking for the thrill of freelancer life, I've got you covered. You will learn how to get the best freelance work, how to get your work discovered to attract more clients, how to correctly structure your portfolio, best practices to follow as a freelancer, and more…
This means that you will be able to create the freelance work-hard/play-hard lifestyle you want, earn a living, and still have time for conventions and games.

How To Create Your Own Brand
As artists, what we want most is to be known for our accomplishments and abilities. In this guide, you will learn how to combine your talents and establish your own personal brand; what it takes to get your brand off the ground, and how to get your brand to scale.
This means you will have the groundwork to expand your influence so you can gain the recognition & wealth you desire.

How To Create Your Own Products/Services
Some of you have always wanted to create your own games/products/services and sell them online via Kickstarter, Shopify, or Amazon. In this guide, you will learn how to start your own line of products/services, how to fail fast & improve, and how to sell your products/services profitably.
Understanding & applying the lessons from this section means you will be on the fastest road to 6+ figures.

How to Develop The Successful Illustrator Mentality
You will learn how to think like a successful illustrator and see the world as yours to make & create. You will develop a growth mindset that will enable you to try hard things and accomplish great feats.
This means that you will be able to see opportunities that you weren't previously able to see and you'll have the courage to reach out and grab them.

And so much more...
 How you are going to get the biggest bang for your buck by backing this guide today. 
30+ years of experience, industry insights, and advice from 13 award winning illustrators who have all been in the trenches and climbed to success; the information in this book is worth thousands. You could spend an entire academic career at an art university and still not even come close to learning the gems that are in this guide. 
Luckily, this isn't art school so you won't have to take out student loans to get access to this valuable information. For this Kickstarter only, I am going to give you access to a massive discount. 
I'll give you one copy of "What They don't Teach in Art School" for the price of $29 for a soft cover or $39 for a hard cover. 
The invaluable knowledge of how to monetize your art skills and craft your own successful career all for a fraction of the cost of student loans, housing, text books, and Tuition. This deal lasts only for the duration of the Kickstarter. It will go back to full price afterwards. Claim your guide at a massive discount today!
Soft Cover
Hard Cover


So What? Why should I care? 
The vast majority of artists out there have the art skills to earn a living, but they have no clue how to monetize their skills; so they starve. Artists just assume that if they don't have any opportunities to make money with their art now; they will never have any opportunities in the future. This is false. They just lack the understanding of how to apply their art.
What They don't Teach in Art School gives artists the edge they need to go out there and make a successful career for themselves. 
If you personally apply the principles in this book:
* You'll learn how to establish a career where you are both earning a living and creatively fulfilled.
* You'll learn where to spend your time to get your career off the ground and save a lot of money in the long run.
* You'll skip past mistakes and obstacles that inexperienced illustrators make in the industry today.
* You won't have to listen to that naysayer in your life, you know the one, and instead you'll take life into your own hands.
* You'll be recognized for your own content and your own brand.
* You won't have to be afraid of the future and instead look at it as your oyster.
Fear is a tough thing to shrug off. It paralyzes you from head to toe; preventing you from taking the necessary steps towards success. The greatest source of fear is the anxiety of not knowing how your future will play out. But let me clue you in on a secret, the future is yours to decide. You have what it takes! Decide to make your future a bright one. I wrote this guide to help illustrators, like you, to succeed in the most challenging time of your life. It's going to take work, there are no shortcuts, but there are open highways.
- Will Terry

Shipping & Fulfillment
Both soft & hard cover books are ready to be printed!
Books will ship to the United States & Internationally. You will not pay for shipping until after the completion of the Kickstarter during fulfillment  (estimated to be in October). I will be using Backerkit to help me with fulfillment. Backerkit makes fulfillment quick and easy! I will not mark up shipping whatsoever, you will only pay what is fair.  
When we are ready to ship the books (probably in October) you will receive an alert to complete a survey (to be sent to the email address that you provided with your pledge). That survey will ask for your current/updated mailing address to ensure that your order will arrive to you directly. You will pay for shipping at that time -AND- GREAT NEWS: YOU WILL ALSO HAVE THE OPTION TO ADD MORE COPIES TO YOUR ORDER AT THAT TIME! You'll also have the chance to purchase add-ons, such as other books and prints by Will Terry.
If you have any further questions, feel free to ask me personally.

campaign.story:
Click here to visit the Blacklist Games Facebook page!
I'm Adam Sadler, senior game designer at Blacklist Games, and I love miniatures. They are what got my brother Brady and me into the hobby back when we were teenagers. Whether we’re using them in roleplaying games, board games, or tabletop miniatures games, we love collecting, assembling, painting, and playing with them. While Blacklist Games has published several of our games that feature miniatures, they saw our passion could be used for the creation of a new division that would focus solely on miniatures and allow for company growth in parallel with creating great board games. With everyone at the company excited about the possibility of this new division, here we are to share it with you!
Blacklist Miniatures will focus entirely on producing high quality, highly detailed, pre-assembled plastic miniatures to be used in any type of game. Blacklist Miniatures: Fantasy Series 1, our first miniatures line, is not only a celebration of our love for miniatures, but also of all things fantasy.
With your support, this campaign will not only bring this project to life, but also open the door to other lines of miniatures in various genres and even new games to utilize them! 
Blacklist Games has published several board games that include detailed plastic miniatures. With each game we publish, we learn more about how to improve the quality of the miniatures we produce. When you compare the miniatures in our first game, Street Masters, with those in our most recent game, Altar Quest, you can see these improvements.
Blacklist Miniatures will take this experience and apply it to produce our best miniatures yet. These miniatures are 28mm scale and will be produced in PVC plastic.
Dragon (Kickstarter Exclusive!)
Male Elf Paladin
Orc
Ooze
QUARTERMASTER LOGISTICS
Blacklist Games, LLC is proud to announce that Quartermaster Logistics (QML) will be handling our fulfillment for Blacklist Miniatures: Fantasy Series 1.
QML has an outstanding reputation for their transparent and stellar customer service, allowing for backers to get freight/shipping updates and personable QA solutions directly from them. From what we’ve seen, they have high standards when it comes to ensuring packages are delivered with enough protection and care to give backers and publishers a peace of mind.
Finding the perfect fit for logistics has been an immense test of trial and error, but after better understanding the needs of backers and our own expectations, we are now confident and excited for this new direction and our partnership with QML for this campaign.
Shipping
Like our previous campaigns, shipping will be collected after this Kickstarter campaign concludes based on the actual costs incurred to ship, via our pledge manager (see the “Terms and Conditions” section below for more details). This is because shipping varies from region to region.
Depending on which region you are in, we will ship from the following hubs: UK (for EU/UK backers), China (for Asia Pacific backers), Canada (for Canadian backers), Australia (for Australia and New Zealand backers) or Indiana (for USA and the rest of the world).
Please note: Altar Quest add-ons (Altar Quest Quest Tier Pledge, Ruins of Arkenspire, First Four) will ship in a separate, earlier wave. See below for details.
SHIPPING FOR FANTASY SERIES 1 ITEMS
The current estimated delivery for Fantasy Series 1 items (Adventurer Tier, Guildmaster Tier, Altar Quest Lurker Pack add-on) is December 2020.
The following is a list of rough estimates for shipping a standard game package (4kg or 8.8lbs volumetric weight).Keep in mind costs may increase based on weight from unlocked stretch goals and/or any optional add-ons purchased.
USA: $10-$15 to most states. $65 to Alaska, Hawaii, and Puerto Rico.
CANADA: $12-$18 to most cities.
LATIN AMERICA: $70-$80 to most countries (see below).
ASIA: $10-$15 to China, Hong Kong, and Singapore. $35 to most other countries.
OCEANIA: $20-$25 to Australia and New Zealand.
AFRICA: $95 to most countries.
EUROPE: $15-$20 to most countries.
$25-$30 to Norway, Switzerland, Finland, Estonia, and Latvia.
$50 to Bosnia/Herzegowina, Croatia, and Iceland.
$65-$70 to Israel, Liechtenstein, and Serbia.
  Unfortunately, because of certain import laws and customs, we currently are NOT ABLE TO SHIP TO Afghanistan, Argentina, Brazil, Kazakhstan, Ukraine, Russia.
If your territory is listed above we hope to be able to offer our product to you later at retail, but are unable to commit to shipping to these territories during the Kickstarter.
SHIPPING FOR ALTAR QUEST ADD-ONS
If you pledge for any of the Altar Quest add-ons (Altar Quest Quest Tier Pledge, First Four Hero Pack, Ruins of Arkenspire) during this campaign, they will be shipped to you separately from your Fantasy Series 1 items. They will be shipped in the same time period as rewards are shipped to backers of the Altar Quest campaign (current estimate is July 2020).
You will pay for this shipment based on the shipping rates from the Altar Quest Kickstarter campaign. In other words, you will pay the same shipping costs that Altar Quest backers paid for these items to be shipped.
Terms and Conditions
By pledging to this project, you acknowledge that you have read and accepted the following terms and conditions.
FINAL PRODUCT
The products/rewards shown on this Kickstarter page are subject to change. The final products/rewards you receive could differ from what is presented here.
PROJECT UPDATES
It is your responsibility as a backer of this project to read project updates in order to stay up to date with important details and requests from the Blacklist Games team.
COMMUNICATING WITH BLACKLIST GAMES POST-CAMPAIGN
Please note that we do not monitor the Kickstarter messaging inbox outside of a live Kickstarter campaign. Therefore, after this project has ended, please ensure to send all communications to customerservice@blacklistgamesllc.com
REFUND POLICY
Full refunds are available within 14 days of the campaign’s end date. All refunds taking place within 14 days of the close of the campaign are reversed in full via Stripe to your credit card.
Afterwards, refunds minus the Kickstarter and payment processing fees (which we cannot recuperate) will be available before and during the first 30 days the pledge manager is open. Once these initial 30 days have passed, no refunds will be possible. A reminder of the refund cutoff date will be announced in project updates.
This project is being funded in USD and any refunds processed will be in USD for the exact amount received in USD, excluding any applicable fees depending on the time of the refund being processed as previously stated.
COMPLETING THE PLEDGE MANAGER
In the weeks following the conclusion of the campaign, an email invitation to our pledge manager will be sent to all backers to allow them entry to the pledge manager; further details on this process will be provided in a project update published around the same time the email invites are sent out.
Backers must confirm their “order” (pledge rewards + purchased add-ons) in our pledge manager before its closing date in order to receive their order. “Confirming your order” means entering your valid shipping information and paying any balances due for shipping costs and selected add-ons in the pledge manager.
If you confirm your order by the closing date of the pledge manager, you agree that our responsibility to you is to ship your confirmed order as entered into the pledge manager. That title and risk passes to you upon delivery to a common carrier for such shipment, and you are responsible for import duties or any other duties that may be payable to the relevant tax authorities, providing correct address information and ensuring this address is deliverable by normal methods.
If you do not confirm your order before the closing date of the pledge manager, you agree that we have fulfilled our obligations to you in full for payments/donations received. However, we may, at our discretion, agree to place you on a waiting list for backers with unconfirmed orders if you contact us after the closing date of the pledge manager but before fulfillment of rewards begins. Backers on this list will be contacted once initial fulfillment to backers has concluded in order to offer them a final chance to complete their orders; note that this process would not involve the pledge manager and that any shipments sent as a result of this process would not benefit from any “friendly shipping” rates offered during the Kickstarter campaign and would undoubtedly be shipped at a higher cost due to not benefitting from overall Kickstarter shipping rates. 
Remember that unconfirmed pledges make it difficult for us to plan production and logistics, and could lead to project delays. For this project we do not intend to allow this to happen, therefore if you do not complete your order by the pledge manager’s closing date, we cannot guarantee the availability of add-ons/exclusive items in sufficient quantity for your pledge.

I want to help aspiring artists, of all styles and all ages, become the artists of their dreams with this super affordable alternative to art school. 
Hi, I'm artist Jason Brubaker and Cognitive Drawing is a learn-to-draw workbook unlike any other you've seen.
This workbook solves a difficult problem: How can artists learn to draw anything quickly if they don't have access to art schools or the money to pay for an art education?

I've spent 3 years developing this workbook to accomplish that goal and help you become the artist that you want to be!
We are printing the book on high-quality-sketch-book-paper perfect for drawing with pencil. 
Cognitive Drawing will be designed to fold flat on your drawing table just like a sketch book. 
How did Cognitive Drawing Start?
When I was a kid I discovered a method to teach myself how to draw anything from memory. Later on I learned that this method is similar to what cognitive research has called "The Testing Effect". 
Studies have shown that The Testing Effect is one of the most efficient ways your brain retains new longterm information and this book was developed using these same scientific principles.
Cognitive Drawing has had over 1300 Beta Testers which have included Homeshoolers, Charter Schools, High Schools, hobbyists and those who just wanted to expand on their college educations. 
Of those testers 90% saw an immediate improvement in their drawing AND retained what they learned.
 LINK: Four Page Cognitive Drawing Sample PDF (Download)
Better yet, here is a demo video if me doing the sample PDF!
Over the course of 90 days I'll be teaching you the techniques that have made me a successful artist. 
With Cognitive Drawing learning to draw is as easy as... 
What are Students Saying?
Whether it's for personal use, homeschooling or the education system. Give Cognitive Drawing a try and see why families around the nation are calling it "The best way to learn to draw!"
SHIPPING
We will be using Floship for the fulfillment of this project.
"This project's logistics plan has passed a thorough 7-point review and Floship certifies that we have an efficient and reliable logistics plan to deliver this good from the factory to you, the customers."
See Floship certification and information here: https://certification.floship.com/c/cognitive-drawing/

campaign.story:
Hi, I'm Jake Parker, an independent artist based in Arizona. I specialize in comics, illustration, and designing characters, robots, and machines. You may also know me from Instagram, Twitter, YouTube, or as the creator of the popular online art challenge: Inktober. 
It's been 3 years since my last art book and I thought it was high time to make a new one just for you! 
The book will be beautifully printed by a 4 color offset printing press. It will be a softcover, perfect-bound book that will fit nicely with the other books in the DRAWINGS series. It will hold a comprehensive collection of both finished and exploratory artworks from the last three years, including an exclusive SKULL CHASER comic made especially for it. There will be a step-by-step tutorial on my drawing process as well.
This is the FIFTH book in my series of DRAWINGS art books and I felt it was time to mix things up a bit and change the nature and design of these books for the next several publications starting with DRAWINGS 5.
You can order these books right now from my shop. If they're out of print, I have a digital download option available.
Along with the book there's a bunch of other stuff that is only available from this Kickstarter. I'm excited to make these things and get them out to you!
Note: this is a living, breathing project. All designs are pretty close to what I would like to produce, but are subject to change.
 Note: "ALL The Extras" now includes the bookmark set as well!

The book is getting made! YESSS! And now we're shooting to add these stretch goals to your book - at no extra cost to you!!

My team and I are shipping from the US, so apologies for the high cost of shipping to countries outside of North America. We're charging *exactly what it costs us* to ship from the USA. So if you live in London or Sydney or Berlin, shipping prices are what they are. If we can find an affordable way to ship to you we will use it, and keep you updated here.
All rewards will be sent out at the same time (both signed and unsigned). However, if there is a very high number of backers, please keep in mind that it will take us a few days to work our way through packaging all the rewards. 
Unforeseen delays that are out of our control can occur during delivery, so please allow an additional two weeks before checking up on your package. We will be doing our best to make sure everything gets to you on time!
Sometimes orders get lost or damaged in the mail. In that case, we will work with you to make sure you get your book. For instance, if your book is damaged, please contact us and we will have you return the damaged book for a replacement. We are not responsible for lost packages marked as "delivered." 
It's Kickstarter season, and that means a few friends of mine are also running Kickstarters right now. If you like what I'm doing here, you might also like these projects. 
All of these creators I know personally and know that they supplement their income with conventions and with the situation right now none of us are sure if selling at shows will be an option this year. Just a couple bucks from a bunch of people could make a huge difference for these projects.  Go check them out and throw some support their way!
Derek Laufman's Creations
Creations Vol 1 is Derek Laufman's first art book entirely comprised of original designs. The book will be jam packed with hundreds of illustrations, beautifully displayed across 100 pages and 7.5 x 10" in size with a soft cover. This book is for all ages showcasing character designs, concept art, and visual development. With full color illustrations, rough sketches, traditional ink and ink washed artwork. It's a great book for professional artists, art directors, aspiring creators or just fans of art and pop culture. Printed In CANADA LINK
Dave and Fred's Story/Line
From my friends Fred Shroeder and Dave Kellet comes one-on-one interviews w/ artists from comics & animation, talking about their craft. "Art and Stories and the Art of Telling Stories." I was one of their "test" interviews and I think it's a great platform to learn about the craft of comics, while also elevating the art form. LINK
Sketch Wallet's Little Sketchy
Introducing Little Sketchy - A Sketch Wallet for Kids! It’s a wallet with a pencil and replaceable sketchbook inside.The sketchbook is filled with tips, prompts, activities and more to get the creative juices flowing.  It comes in two styles designed by Parker Jacobs and Ralph Thomas. Our goal is to make drawing fun and to build great sketching habits. It also comes with an Artistic License which means you can do whatever you want in the name of art. Don’t want to clean your room? Bam! Just flash your license! Check out the Kickstarter: LINK
Beorn: The Littlest Viking Saga
Ben Bender, a freelance cartoonist who works mostly with all-ages and kid-friendly art and stories, is making BEORN: The Littlest Viking Saga! LINK
I just wanted to thank everyone who has supported my projects over the years. I love drawing, and I love making books. I can't believe that I have enough support from people like you to get to do this for a living. It really is a childhood dream come true.
Thank you for your interest in this campaign. I hope you think this deserves to exist and will consider backing the project to make that a reality.
Thanks,
Jake

campaign.story:
Little Sketchy™ 
A Sketch Wallet For Kids (and adults that refuse to grow up)!
We've created a Sketch Wallet with kids in mind. Building good drawing habits and making sketching fun is the goal of our latest creation.  
 The wallet is 3.25 x 4.25" and is made of high quality printed vinyl. The inside has an ID window pocket, a card pocket, and a money pocket for your cash. Each wallet comes with a small pencil and a 2.5 x 3.75" replaceable sketchbook filled with drawing activities to prime the creative pump.  
Many parents have asked me how to keep their young artist going. I believe they should provide them with a few things: 
"Encouragement" will need to come from you, but we can help with the "fresh art supplies" and "inspiration" to make drawing fun and accessible. Each wallet comes with a replaceable sketchbook filled with tips, prompts, activities and more to get the creative juices flowing. Your artist will definitely come away with new skills and fun stuff to draw. There are also plenty of blank pages that will allow unguided creativity. Our small blank, toned, dot-grid and lined books also fit this wallet. 
Many artists don't begin to carry a sketchbook until they hit college age or older. Help the young artist in your life to develop this habit early, it will only help them get better. Drawing at a young age should only have one goal...it should be fun. You'll have plenty of opportunity to dash their hopes and dreams later. Don't get hung up on, "you drew the head too big," or "the perspective is all wrong." Criticism before they're ready will squeeze the love right out of it. If they can keep drawing through middle school and into high school then they are probably ready for honest critiques. You'll know because they'll ask for it.
We've had this on the idea board for a couple years and thought it was time to make this thing. We have been trying several designs, interviewing young people, measuring pockets, checking out materials and so on. We love the final designs and know you will too. 
 The first wallet was designed by the ever-doodling Parker Jacobs. Parker has been posting his daily doodles for the past decade. You may recognize his work from Paul Frank Industries, Yo Gabba, Gabba, The Aquabats and Goon Holler. Parker has a bad habit of letting his domain names run out.
 The second wallet was designed by Sketch Wallet creator Ralph Thomas. He's proven that even a mediocre artist can make a living in illustration and has spent the last 10 years as a game artist. When he's not drawing he's found riding his trusty green bike, "the Bass-O-Matic™" or stealing Parkers websites (Exhibit A, Exibit B).
Special Thanks to Miles, Raegan, and Aaliyah :-)

campaign.story:
The Dice Tower:
This dice tower was designed by our in-house designer here at GameTank to use during our late-night game sessions. It was so useful and attractive that we felt it deserved to be launched as a set people could purchase for a reasonable price. So we reached out to our manufacturer and worked with them to create this set.
So, who are these guys?
We are a group of toy developers, game designers, and brick enthusiasts that want to bridge the gap between bricks and tabletop RPGs. We have a lot of experience in toys and manufacturing and want to use those connections and knowledge to create awesome sets to enhance your game. Our first set will be this dice tower, then we move onto sets that support the most popular campaign settings and modules.
What will happen now that the Kickstarter is funded?
After we receive funds, production will begin. The smallest order we can place for a product like this is 1000 sets. This will take 1 month for the factory to complete. Then they will be shipped in a container to our warehouse in the US, this will also take 1 month. Then the warehouse will ship all of the orders out to your addresses.
After we fulfill the Kickstarter, we will launch our eCommerce site where people will be able to place orders for this dice tower and future sets.
 Future sets? 
Yep, we already have a few sets lined up for release after this one. The next set will be around 1500 pieces and feature a campaign with 3 sessions worth of play. We will continue releasing new Dice Towers through our website, but our primary focus will be sets with full campaigns.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
When we receive funding (two weeks after the end of the Kickstarter) we will begin production with the manufacturer. Most of this process is already taken care of. They understand our design, and have all of the printing and molding machines ready to go. 

Once the product is manufactured we need to get the product all the way from the manufacturer overseas to our warehouse here in Chicago. The product will the be delivered in a large crate on a ship, and arrive at our warehouse 30 days later. 

Then the warehouse will organize the product and ship it out to all of our backers. 

We hope to have everything done by February, but sometimes plans go airy, and logistic issues arise that slow down the process. We will do everything we can to keep everything running smoothly, and post updates every week about the progress.

campaign.story:
Spire's End is a solo and cooperative card game that hearkens back to the game books of the '80s with enemy encounters, interactive story-driven scenarios, and high-end art and design.  It's a unique gaming experience without a lot of baggage. Simple set-up, intuitive rules and minimal components. No DM, no bookkeeping or character sheet. Just you, an oversized deck of cards, dice and cube markers.
My influences for this game are rooted in the nostagia of my childhood. D&D, Planet of the Apes, Land of the Lost, Heavy Metal Magazine, Zork, and Monkey Island, to name a few.

It's the grisly tale of a strange tower that emerges in the heart of a bustling Viking city. The townsfolk have vanished. It’s up to you to mount a rescue and unravel the mystery. 
You move through the game like a book. But in this case, it's a stack of ominous cards. Flip them over, make difficult choices and let the story unfold. 

You have an Ally Deck with 6 adventurers (6 chances) to face the countless dangers of the spire. From this deck you will randomly pick 2 starting Allies. But be warned, your path is paved in blood. If they die, and they will you will randomly select another Ally to take their place.




This is a six-chapter adventure, each of which includes a major encounter, loot, choices, dice chucking and more! It will require both skill and luck. 
The hook is simple. In combat you perform actions at a cost. That cost is your character's hit points. Every action is a risk. To execute stronger attacks you will need to spend more hit points, which in turn leaves you weak and vulnerable. This makes for tense, close, ruthless battles.
Please note: This is a simplistic look at some basics in combat. There are many exciting variables to actions and their outcomes detailed in the instructions deck. Check out Kickbacks, Status Effects, Rest meters and more!
Enemies will fight in a similar fashion, with a few exceptions. They don't spend Hit Points and their actions are determined by the Action Deck.
Each enemy you will face has different hooks and mechanics to make them interesting. Some have story branches that trigger in the midst of battle.


What would an adventure be without pesky trash mobs getting in your way? You can't head out on your first quest without clearing rats out of a cellar, right?

My goal was to make this game with as few components as possible without taking away from the gaming experience. It's a clean minimalistic approach to an in-depth and engrossing adventure.
The focus has always been the story deck. The heart of the game. It represents the spire, and each card is a layer you uncover during your descent. 
From the very start I wanted ENORMOUS PLAYING CARDS. These are custom 6.5 x 3.5 inch cards. They are about the same size as an iPhone X and they're glorious. Here's what's in the box. 



This is not a randomly generated gaming experience. The concept here is to experience a specific storyline with multiple chapter branches and endings. Your choices, enemy encounters and items you discover will influence the overall narrative. There are multiple endings to uncover, some more unpleasant than others.



Here is a look at the current Card Progression Tree for Chapters 1 and 2 to help illustrate the branching paths. Each square is a card. Black = Story Card, Red = Item Card, Dark Red = Encounter. Your story can splinter out in many different directions.






Considering the complexities of the project I want to be transparent with the progress made and what's left to do.

Greg is an Art Director and Graphic Designer currently residing in Los Angeles, CA. In his free time he's pumping whatever pop culture he can into his veins..or dreaming up new encounters for Spire's End!

Benjamin is a Digital Artist from Berlin, Germany currently working as a freelance concept artist and illustrator. These days he uses every available minute for art and game design.
Erica is co-owner of Oaktown Spice Shop in Oakland, CA. Before starting a retail business with her husband, she was a journalist. She loves to cook and drink wine.
Christian is co-owner of Hop Merchants Bottle Shop & Taproom, a craft beer bar in North Hollywood, CA.  He's a writer, a gamer and horror film fanatic.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is my first venture into the madness of crowdfunding and it’s incredibly daunting. But with more than 15 years of graphic design and packaging experience, I am merely in a state of heightened panic.

This project, like many, started with very ambitious goals before it was wrangled into something reasonable for my first attempt. It began as a 12 chapter, 200 card epic. Due to the sheer scope of the game, production costs and the fact that I am just one person, the game is now 6 Chapters, with the hopes to continue later if successful.

The style guides and templates are set, and the writing for Chapters 1-6 are more than halfway there.

My aim is to keep things simple without compromising the game as much as possible. That being said, even with “simple” in mind I know that problems lurk around every corner. Game balancing and rewrites take time so I am giving myself a considerable amount of lead time to get this labor-intensive job done properly.

Nobody wants this game in their hands more than me. I dream about this thing. I spend my time in the shower planning the next encounter. I’m going to do everything I can to get this out before the spire drags me down into the bowels of the underworld. Who’s with me?
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
What are the risks and challenges that come with completing your project, and how are you qualified to overcome them?

!! VERY IMPORTANT - PLEASE READ !! 

PRODUCTION AND FULFILLMENT

For a project like ours, the risks and challenges fall into three categories:
1) Overall Non-completion.
2) Delays in meeting our estimated delivery dates.
3) We do not produce a specific model or change/subtract or add a piece to a specific model.
4) The bulk of our Kickstarter will be made in China. A tariff in excess of 50% or a ban on Chinese imports would seriously delay delivery and/or, in a worse case, shutdown this project entirely. If such an event occurs early on in this project, refunds (less charges and expense payments made) might be possible. If it occurs later in this project (after almost all expenses have been paid) there would be little and possibly no refunds. 

Concerning the risk of Overall Non-completion: we've already completed several massive Kickstarters and are fully aware of the pitfalls. Two things that could cause the non-completion of this Kickstarter are either the loss of our inbound shipments (due to an act of God, pirates or war), or a massive disaster (fire, flood) that levels our facility. Either of those events might be disastrous, however we carry full insurance on our facility and insure every shipment against loss or damage.

Obviously either of the above tragic events would create delays in meeting our estimated delivery dates, and that brings us to the second category: delays. We have learned a lot from our Kickstarters. However, delays are simply part of the cycle of business and it is our wisdom, training, and experience that helps us mitigate and work through any delay. Some delays, like ones we have control or exercise input over, are easy to solve. Other delays that are out of our control, such as US Customs and Border Protection and Consumer Product Safety Commission inspections and dock yard labor strikes are examples of delays out of our control. In the end we do everything possible to avoid any delay and will always update you as soon as possible.

Lastly there is the risk we will not produce a specific model shown. This will only occur if there is not enough interest in a specific model measured by the number of backers that actually pledge for to back it verses the cost to produce it. This event has never occurred in any of our previous Kickstarters, but is nonetheless still a risk. In the event this situation develops you will have plenty of time to adjust your Pledge Manager.

Also we reserve the right to modify any model or piece of a model shown to meet cost and production requirements. Modifications may include the removal or addition of new parts to a model. 

REFUND POLICY

If it is within 14 days of the closing of this Kickstarter we will refund your entire pledge amount. After 14 days, but before the closing of this Kickstarter’s Reaper Pledge Manager, we will refund your entire pledge minus the 10% Kickstarter and Processing Fees we incur. Once the Reaper Pledge Manager closes, refund requests are subject to review and not all requests may be honored.

YOUR BACKER RESPONSIBILITY IN THIS KICKSTARTER

If you do not log in and confirm your pledge in the Reaper Pledge Manager by August 31, 2020 you agree that we have fulfilled our obligations to you in full for payment or donations received. However, we may, at our discretion, refund or ship your pledge if you contact us and confirm your pledge after August 31, 2020.

Unconfirmed pledges make it difficult for us to plan production and logistics. If you confirm your pledge late (after April 30, 2021) some items may not still be available. This means that part, if not all, of your rewards may not be available and/or your pledge may be forfeit.

You are responsible for all fees associated with the transit and acceptance by you to complete delivery. These include, but are not limited to: import duties or any other duties that may be payable to the relevant and taxing authorities, VAT and GST due and delivery acceptance, brokerage and collection charges.

updates.update_content:
Happy Saturday!
This is an unscheduled update regarding our last remaining containers. 

USA Hub: We're still waiting on our last two containers to arrive at our warehouse. The good news is that one of them is in the DFW area and is awaiting CBP and CPSC inspection. As soon as that's done, we could have the container here at any time. Please note that we have had inspections take one day, and we've had inspections take 3 weeks. We are hoping that it will be days rather than weeks.  Our second container is still in Long  Beach and has not been sent by rail to DFW yet.  We will continue to monitor and keep everyone informed of the status.

updates.update_userinfo: Light at the End of the Tunnel
updates.update_content:
Hello Backers!
Not a whole lot of hard information, but a few nuggets to get us through the weekend.
Boat Plugs: turns out they're not necessary
USA Shipping: We're targeting the week of June 14th to start shipping. We call this a "soft" date.
UK Shipping: The UK warehouse is expecting its last container on June 8th
AU Shipping: Finalizing some software issues, but shipping should begin soon; "soft" date of June 14.

updates.update_userinfo: The Waiting Continues and Ship Update
updates.update_content:
Hi Backers!
Unfortunately, this update doesn't come with any relevant news regarding the start of fulfillment.
We're still waiting for containers to arrive here in the USA, UK, and Australia. 
We cannot begin fulfillment until all products arrive and are accounted for.
Once a zone receives its full inventory, it will begin fulfillment regardless of the other zones' inventories.

Hey Backers!
Not a lot of big news in the last two weeks, but a few small developments.
We're still waiting for the last container to arrive containing Ghost Pirate Ships and the remaining Options. We received the supplies for the Bones 5 Learn to Paint Kit and our team has already assembled all of these. 
Containers to our UK and AU hubs are still on the way; containers for Australia were expected to arrive last week but our Australian warehouse has not confirmed possession yet. UK containers are not expected to arrive until June 5th. We will continue to keep everyone posted and will post an update as soon as these warehouses begin fulfillment.

Hey Backers!
Not a lot of big news in the last two weeks, but a few small developments.
Three more containers arrived this past week, two of which contained most of the Pirate Ship models for USA fulfillment. This thing is HUGE and you guys are going to love it!
The third container was filled with various Options from Bones 5, including Aganzarax, Valfuryx, the War Mammoth, and most of the Extras from the Core Set.

Hello Backers!
Thanks for hanging in there while your Kickstarter rewards wind their way into your hands!
UK/EU Shipping
Let's tackle this topic right off the top. Last week, Reaper CEO and President Ed Pugh went on our weekly Twitch show and talked at length about the UK/EU shipping process.

Hi Backers!
First, apologies for missing the last scheduled update. We got wrapped up in our Reaper Virtual Expo and we simply missed it. We will try to do better!
Peeking Behind the Curtain

Hi Backers,
Apologies, but very little info this update as well. With a historic wave of bad weather sweeping through Texas last week and yours truly contracting Covid, there's not much to report.  

However, the first containers are on the water and are scheduled to arrive on the west coast next week. If all goes well, we should have containers arriving at our warehouse at the beginning of March! More containers are expected to ship at the end of February after CNY.

updates.update_userinfo: Container Shipments Underway to our USA Warehouse

Our manufacturing partners overseas have shipped several containers before the Chinese New Year holiday beginning next week. 
This is great news, as it allows us to start the organization and planning phase of fulfillment as we await the remaining containers that will ship following the end of CNY later in February.
