campaign.story:
Samples painted by Adam Sadler and Allyssa Perry. Miniatures come unpainted.
Altar Quest is a cooperative game of fantasy adventure inspired by the classic dungeon crawling board games that many of us grew up with. Using the Modular Deck System (MDS), introduced in Street Masters and Brook City, the game features incredibly modular gameplay using several different types of decks. Hero decks, threat decks, villain decks, and quest decks can all be mixed and matched along with altar cards, feature cards, and other game elements to create countless combinations of unique adventures. With an engaging one-off experience and narrative campaign play, Altar Quest offers players endless adventure in a unique fantasy setting with years of support planned for the game.
Whether playing an individual quest or part of a campaign, each quest is made up of a combination of several different decks and other game elements. Heroes must complete the goal set out by the chosen quest deck in order to win the game. They must overcome several obstacles during the quest determined by the chosen threat deck and villain deck, as well as the deck of lurker cards. If any hero is defeated, the heroes lose the game.
All Original Fantasy Setting
Altar Quest takes place mainly in a realm called Aridika—a land of high fantasy and Gothic horror. As players dive deeper into the game, they’ll learn about the deep lore and many mysteries that hide within the shadows of Aridika and the world of Rhuna. Designers Adam & Brady Sadler have been developing the world of Rhuna since their early days of playing Dungeons & Dragons, and are excited to share it and expand it with Altar Quest.
Altars
The world of Rhuna was created by powers called “rhunes”—godlike essences that came together to create all existence. Mortals were never intended to wield the untempered powers of rhunes, so they were crystallized deep within the earth to keep the lands above in balance. Unfortunately, evil finds a way, and deep below Aridika where the lich queen Szera slumbers, the rhunestones have been corrupted and forced to the surface. These altars are worshipped by power-hungry opportunists that use the rhunic energies surrounding them to further their own nefarious plans… 
During each quest, the chosen altar card will constantly affect the state of the altar pool. The altar pool is made up of 5 altar dice that are rolled at the start of the quest. Each altar die has 6 unique sides, each one containing a rhune symbol. These rhunes are used by the heroes, as well as the enemies, to trigger special effects. After an effect is triggered by a rhune symbol, the altar die showing that symbol is rolled and the new symbol is added to the altar pool. Players will have to balance using their rhune effects with making sure they aren’t empowering the enemy too much.
Incredibly Modular
Featuring the versatile Modular Deck System (MDS) that the Sadlers first introduced with Street Masters, the variability of Altar Quest is one of its key features. Players will have a world to explore by mixing hero decks, villain decks, threat decks, and quest decks with fluctuating feature decks to keep the environments fresh. Players can create their ideal game scenarios by matching up decks of their choice, or leave it to fate and embark on a randomized quest!
Truly Solo, Truly Cooperative
Altar Quest features an elegant player scaling solution built into the core design of the game, which means one player can play the game as easily as up to four, with no exceptions or special rules. 
Three Great Ways to Play
While Altar Quest is designed to be a satisfying one-off adventure, players can also embark on an epic campaign by linking their quests together, earning upgraded cards for their decks, finding new equipment, and facing new challenges with enemy upgrades. Additionally, stories allow players to explore the vibrant setting of Aridika by playing through a story deck using the campaign rules.
For more information on the add-ons, click here.
Show your support for Altar Quest by donning one of many avatars available here: https://www.blacklistgamesllc.com/altarquest
Shipping Info 
Like our previous campaigns, shipping will be collected after the Kickstarter based on the actual costs incurred to ship, via our pledge manager after the campaign ends. This is so we can be fair to all our backers as shipping varies from region to region and doing so will allow us to provide more stretch goals for you during the campaign!
Depending on what region you are in, we will ship from the following hubs: UK (for EU/UK backers), China (for Asia Pacific backers),  Canada (for Canadian backers), Australia (for Australia and New Zealand backers) or Indiana (for USA and the rest of the world). 
The following is a list of rough estimates for shipping a standard game package (4kg or 8.8lbs volumetric weight). Keep in mind these are just estimates and costs may increase based on weight from unlocked stretch goals and/or any optional buys you get.
USA: $10-$20 to most states. $50 to Alaska, Hawaii, and Puerto Rico. 
CANADA: $15-$30 to most cities. 
LATIN AMERICA: $70-$80 to most countries (see below). 
ASIA: $10-$15 to China, Hong Kong, and Singapore. $35 to most other countries.
OCEANIA: $25-$35 to Australia and New Zealand. 
AFRICA: $95 to most countries. 
EUROPE: $20-$30 to most countries (see below).  
 • $35 to Norway, Switzerland, Finland, Estonia, and Latvia. 
 • $50 to Bosnia/Herzegowina, Croatia, and Iceland. 
 • $70-$80 to Israel, Liechtenstein, and Serbia.
Unfortunately, because of certain import laws and customs, we currently are NOT ABLE TO SHIP TO Afghanistan, Argentina, Brazil, Kazakhstan, Ukraine, Russia.
If your territory is listed above we hope to be able to offer our product to you later at retail, but are unable to commit to shipping to these territories during the Kickstarter. 
THE LOOMING TARIFFS: We have spoken to our factory and shipping logistic reps and until anything officially changes, nothing will change or affect us cost-wise. If things do start having a financial impact, Blacklist Games, LLC will be absorbing what we can, so we can keep overall costs and shipping as familiar to what you're normally used to with our campaigns. If there are any increases at all, it will be minimal and only be set by any fulfillment costs outside of our control, since we do not intend to randomly up-charge our products for the sake of doing so.
POST PLEDGE MANAGER NOTICE: Any pledges confirmed after our pledge manager deadline will be shipped from the US hub at a later date and will likely incur increased shipping costs since it would be out of our normal fulfillment cycle. For non-US backers that will likely incur import taxes as well. We also cannot ship to PO Boxes domestically or internationally due to the size of each package and the risk of the package being bounced back to us.
Refund Policy
We can refund you within 2 weeks (14 days) of the campaign’s end date, fees included. All refunds taking place within 14 days of the close of the campaign are reversed via Stripe to your credit card. After that, we will accept returns minus the Kickstarter and payment processing fees (which we cannot get back from them) up until our pledge manager is closed. At that point, refunds will no longer be possible. This project is being funded in USD and any refunds processed will be in USD for the exact amount received in USD, excluding any applicable fees depending on the time of the refund being processed.

Following our successful campaigns for Street Masters, Brook City, and Street Masters: Aftershock we continue to learn about how better to improve our marketing, design, manufacturing, fulfillment, and distribution, as well as how best to nurture our growing community. Street Masters and Brook City have been fulfilled and have received high acclaim by reviewers and gamers alike.
Currently, Aftershock is in production at the manufacturer. Per our recent updates, we've approved all samples and they are in mass production, about 5 months early! Altar Quest is extremely exciting, but we are also just as excited and committed to bringing Street Masters: Aftershock to our backers' tabletops as soon as possible.

Fortunately, we've got experienced game designers working hard to ensure the gameplay offers the best experience it can, we have strong relationships with the factory/manufacturer, we have a shipment/fulfillment company already signed on, we are completely passionate about our games, and, most importantly, we care about our backers and their satisfaction.

campaign.story:
The Game Chasers' Motion Picture is a freaking AWESOME fictional adventure following Billy and Jay as they go on the road to track down a childhood gaming relic. If you are a fan of 80's/90's road trip movies and retro video games, this movie is for you. It will capture those warm memories you have for gaming and remind you of those good times while making you laugh along the way. This will be a movie you can watch with the whole family. For fans of the Game Chaser's web series, this is not a 2-hour game chasers episode, it is a feature-length scripted comedy film. However, it will have everything you come to love from the show at its roots, just presented in a new and exciting way!   This will be a different format, of course, from the show (which is reality documentary style) But that's the point, to do something fresh and different!  
We've had an idea to do a movie for a long time, but it wasn't until someone approached us with the concept of a scripted comedy that the light-bulb went off. Our original idea a few years back was a country-wide road trip going to flea markets. Basically exactly what we do on the YouTube show, still keeping it a "reality format", and making it a feature-length movie. And while many might find that idea awesome, I found it boring. It's the same thing we already do just.....longer. And we have to depend on the chance of actually finding games. You wouldn't see Mevor, or Dodongo in it because or work obligations as well. For me, that idea just wasn't exciting. We never pursued it. We never tried to Kickstart it. Maybe we will down the road, but this idea that we have is so much more stimulating creatively for all of us, and a nice breath of fresh air. And the great thing about it for fans is that even though it's a fictional narrative, it still has the essence of the show. It's a refreshing take on Game Chasers. And we are super excited to bring it to life and show the world. 
Now, some people might be concerned over the fact that we have a Producer and that that means someone else other than us is calling the shots. Nothing could be further from the truth. This is OUR project, OUR vision, and the idea and direction is 100 percent OUR creations. We make the decisions. No one controls us, ever. They work for US, not the other way around. I just wanted to ease anyone's concerns that someone else was in charge of this project. This is GAME CHASERS only bigger and badder! What you love about the channel, you will love about this. 
The plan is to shoot over the Spring/Summer and have it ready for release in 2020. There will be a limited theater run, at the minimum here in DFW. But there will also be digital downloads and Blu-rays as well! In the meantime the regular YouTube show isn't going anywhere, so don't worry.  

What's it about????
Well....I can only say so much. A lot of what will make it awesome to see for the first time is the big surprise we have in store. That's good enough, right??? RIGHT? NO? Fine......I can give a quick synopsis, I suppose...... Billy and Jay go on a road trip to track down a childhood gaming relic. And of course...a ridiculous adventure ensues.....a ridiculous adventure but not TOO outside the bounds of reality. Its main purpose is to be FUN to watch but also make you feel good!
Think of this as a fictionalized Game Chasers Prequel. A fun re-telling of how 2 friends became game collectors. 
It will be what you have come to love about the show mixed with stuff you would have never expected, but still fitting in with the spirit of what we do. And also mixed with bigfoots and aliens. Maybe. ;)
PLAY


Ok, how about this? How about I list some words that are out of context but have actual meaning in the movie. Yes, Im a tease. 
Mountain, NES, Shotgun, Campfire, Star Fighter, Gnome, 1988, Flea Market, Lemmy, Battle Toads, Rental, Motorcycle, Gaiden, Photograph, Basement, Drone, Trunk, Punchout, Tetris, Jarr, Abandoned. That's all you get. For now....
For another tease...scroll to the bottom and see a page from the actual script. 
This is just a teaser paying homage to Gremlins, not any official art
In this video we go into the story a little more to hopefully help you understand the theme of what its all about.  
Many of the Game Chasers show fan's favorite episodes were ones that made them both laugh and cry, and this movie will capture that same feeling. You will laugh, cry, cheer, and reflect. Fans of the web-show will get enjoyment out it, as well as those who are not familiar. Its a movie for fans and newcomers alike.  
 I (Billy)  have a passion for storytelling. I have enjoyed making the Game Chasers web series and will continue to do so, but my favorite projects have always been the ones where I can tell a story and or just be creative. The Under The Bridge Game Chasers Episode and our cartoons display that the most, I believe. This movie has been in the planning stages for a while now, but we feel it's finally time to move forward with it.  
Your support right now of this Kickstarter is critical for it's success.
 Making a movie of this magnitude is expensive. As I said, this isn't a 2-hour Game Chaser episode. This is not us just taking a camera and going out a few days a week shooting video. We have a producer. We are hiring a professional film crew for this. We want this to be like any other movie you would see in a theater. THIS IS NOT a normal "web series makes a movie" scenario. Our goal is to shoot this movie on a RED Camera. A RED camera was used in Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 2, to give you an idea of the quality. I DEMAND that this EXCEEDS your expectations.  We have always reached for the best quality in everything we do, and this is no exception. But besides the film crew, there are so many costs that go into this such as, location costs, insurance, paying the cast, props, transportation, post-production, CGI, licensing, lawyers, to name a few. We will need to hire people to do jobs such as accounting so we don't get sued or have the IRS come after us, a production manager so they can organize the dozens of people need to work on this and keep things on schedule, and also the cost of simple things like food for the crew that will add up quick. Luckily I (Billy) will edit so we can save money on that. As you can see, things add up quickly. 95k may seem like a lot, but in movie making terms 95k is still low budget. Remember, this isn't us filming on the fly at the flea market, this is a REAL production.   
This is a Pre-Sell. 
We hope to Pre-Sell enough copies of the movie to cover the costs of making. If we don't, and our goal is not met, then Kickstarter will not charge your card. 
WHY CROWDFUNDING?
Crowdfunding, or "Eat Bacon" as some would call it, is the best way to for us to bring this movie to you. Lucky for us, it's the year 2019 and the film industry has changed so much. There isn't a need to get a studio's backing or get deep pocket investors. We cut out the middle man and allow our product to be funded by the PEOPLE who want it DIRECTLY. The thing is, investors, dropping large sums of money will want a say in the movie, and rightfully so. We want to keep 100 percent control. We have TURNED down an offer for a TON of money from a potential investor because they wanted to make changes.  Our vision is important to us. With that said, we HAVE been able to secure smaller funding from a few sponsors who won't be taking any control. It's not a ton of money, but it helps, and we are always looking for more small sponsors who don't want say in the movie making aspect. 
Obviously, we have always been great at taking low budget and making it look high budget. It's been our MO since we started. 
Reminder: You wont be charged unless we hit our goal
Of course, there are going to be people waving their finger saying we should get investors instead of going directly to our audience who would want to see this movie to fund it. They say we E bacon? With that said, we actually DO have some! As it stands we have around 7k committed from sponsors. However, you can play a huge part in making that higher. IF you guys help fund this now and early on in this campaign, more sponsors will be willing to jump on board since they will see there is a ton of interest and will be way more willing to get involved. However, they still wouldn't be sponsors who would get a say in how we make this movie. If so, we will turn them down. So if you want this to happen, let's do it as soon as you can! Let's show the people what the Chode Nation is all about!
We more than likely not make any profit off this. And we have no plans to pay OURSELVES for the work. Kyle Newman recently said he made nothing off the movie Fanboys in the end. I can see that happening with us. This is a passion project, but even passion projects require funding. If you want to see this movie made let's pull together an make one hell of a movie! 
Here is a pie chart that will show (generally) where the money will be spent. This as of now is a best guess, some areas could end up being cheaper, others more expensive.
Here are a few further breakdowns of what you saw on the graph, and why exactly we need them. These are the jobs/things we will actually have to pay for and not get the "friend" hook-up.
Production Manager - This person handles the business side of things. Like managing the budget, making sure people get paid, employment issues, paperwork and etc. 
Cinematographer - Behind the director (Billy and Melvor) this is the most important crew member. He or she is responsible for the look and cinematography of the movie. We can't do everything, so this person is vital for us. We want to hire someone who knows what they are doing, a professional. This will obviously cost but will be worth it. We want the movie to look good! But beyond that, if we hire someone who is cheap and inexperienced we run the risk of them making a mistake, and a mistake on a movie set can cost thousands of dollars and days of shooting. 
Audio Tech - This person is responsible for recording the audio on the set. Again, if someone messes up this job it can cost money and time, so a professional is needed. 
Assistant Director - While the director and co directors focus on the actual movie making, the Assistant director does the important "dirty" work to free up the directors time. Such as breaking down the script and planning the shooting days, and making sure all the people who need to be on set a certain day are there. They find the best and most efficient way to organize the shooting days to save time and money. 
Set Building - This is a must, and an expensive must. Some of our settings will need to be created because finding a real-life location that we need will be near impossible. I wish I could go into more detail but I would be giving away to much of the plot. Let's just say we will need to create a set that looks like it's from 1988. Also, a few of our settings would be impossible to film in a real life location because there would be no space to fit a camera and crew, so one would need to be built with only 3 walls, so a camera crew could be behind the "fourth wall". All this would need to be built on a sound stage which we would have to rent out from someone. Plus add the cost for materials and people to build said sets.  
Film Equipment - The DP will have a lot of gear but we will more than likely need to rent more and that cost can add up quick. Things such as camera mounts for a car, jibs, lenses, and lighting. Maybe even another camera if needed.  
Location fees - When we CAN shoot in real outside locations rather it be a building, a town, or someone's house, it is rarely ever free. Someone, whoever owns it, will want to be paid. Believe me, we will try to find a place for free or cheap, but it might not be possible.  
Special Effects Tech - Sometimes its cheaper and easier to use miniatures instead of full size real life objects for a particular scene. Tons of movies use models and you never realized it. Apollo 13 and Avatar are two to come to mind, and we have one of the model makers who worked on those movies on board to work with us! He knows the art of the craft and how to make them look real on camera. We are talking professional half-scale and quarter-scale models, not little toys. Big difference. This will make our life SO much easier for a few things we have planned, but we still have to pay him. But it's totally worth it.
Actors - Some of the main actors will be friends, others will not. Regardless, we will still need to pay them. We can't ask someone to step away from work for a week, or a month, or even a few days for shooting and expect them to do it for free. We will also have a lot of actors who are not our friends...we will definitely need to pay them.... 
Flight/hotel -  This is another costly but necessary expense. We will need to fly actors and crew in and out all through the shooting phase. 
Catering - This is not in the pie graph but still important. You can't starve your actors or crew while shooting all day. Food will add up quickly. I hope they like Taco Bell...or bread and water...
Insurance/legal - I hate this one, but it's a must. We are treading new ground here. We have to do things on the up and up to protect ourselves. We can't afford to get sued if someone gets hurt on set. And an entertainment lawyer is a MUST on a movie. One product or logo shown might open ourselves up to get sued, so we need council to tell us what's off limits. 
CGI artist - I already mentioned this but we have an artist who has worked on the Walking Dead on board. Now when I say CGI I don't necessarily mean crazy CGI sets or creatures (for the most part), a lot of CGI you see you don't even know you...see it.. Like wire removal, or fixing a mistake in the scene. CGI is an amazing tool to have, especially when a lot of times its cheaper than just re-shooting a scene. Cheaper...but not free
Miscellaneous - This is everything else. Anything from fixing a broken piece of equipment, to gas for driving to a location.  On a movie set, something can always go wrong. An example would be as follows: We have scheduled a two-day shoot that's outside at a certain location. We have 12 cast and crew members that need to be there, and we have flights booked for everyone. The shoot day comes and then...it RAINS! We have to pay for two extra days of hotels for everyone and reschedule return flights. And some of those people might not be able to stick around after the rain to shoot, so we could have to re-shoot it a week or two later.Yeah, that would be a nightmare. An expensive nightmare. If we get more than expected out of this campaign, then this slice of the pie will get filled up even more due to the old saying, "what can go wrong will go wrong". 
CAMPAIGN FEES - Kickstarter's fees, together with the credit card processing fees, come to about 8.5% - 10%. At our goal of $95k that's up to $9,500. 
Check out the production team so far. It isn't just a bunch of chodes (for the most part), we have real industry people working on this with us! 


More on CGI With Yoshi
Here, Yoshi talks about a somewhat unknown use for CGI that can have a huge impact on storytelling. CGI isn't just for space battles and crazy aliens....for the most part.
 here is Yoshi's IMDB and demo reel
https://m.imdb.com/name/nm4668929/

Again, this is a Pre-SELL. If we don't hit the goal, you will get your money back, but if we do, then you will get a copy of the movie. 
We are NOT asking for FREE money. You will get stuff in return. We are offering some cool rewards for you! You are the VIP of this project. We could easily ask you guys for money now, make the movie, then charge you again to buy it. We don't want to do that, so despite having a significant part of our budget go towards Blu-ray production, we want your money to go towards owning the movie as well as making it. You only have to contribute once to see it! If you ever wanted to be a part of a movie, see how it works up close, and know you helped make it happen, then we have a ton of cool rewards just for you!

Oh, one more thing..... 
Blu-Ray, and poster art not yet finalized
Blu-Rays - These are not cheap to produce. There is a reason most of the film kickstarter projects don't have this perk and the ones that do have them priced higher than a Blu-ray would normally be, it takes money away from your movie budget to make them. However, I know you most of you love physical media, so despite taking a piece of the budget away we are going to produce them for you! campaign.story:
Explore the Relicblade Volgelands with the Moldorf Expedition and the dangerous Lostwood Enclave.
Click through the image to jump into the Relicblade Community on Facebook!
In Relicblade, players recruit the ultimate squad of fantasy heroes or cruel villains as they battle over the fate of the world. Choose your path and gather the greatest warriors of the age to your cause! Enter a world of magical treasures, wonders, and horrors. Compete against rivals in the bitter struggle for supremacy! The rules are deceptively simple and easy to learn, but you'll immediately face deep tactical choices in this dynamic battle game.
This ambitious Kickstarter campaign includes two new faction sets and a campaign book packed with adventures, lore, and much more! New Faction Sets not only expand the game, but also offer a great entry point for new players as they enter the dreaded Volgelands!
Get the Volgelands campaign book, both of the new factions, and the Kickstarter Exclusive "Vandas Greycloak" miniature with the recommended Bold Adventurer pledge level! 
  Relicblade miniatures are cast in white metal for crisp detail.
The Volgelands Adventure Campaign Setting
The Volgelands is the first campaign setting for Relicblade, and the first in-depth exploration of the Relicblade world. The book centers on the region known as the Volgelands. The port city of Riverhold is the beating heart of these cursed lands where feral magic still hold sway. Founded on the divine principles of Justice, but controlled by a powerful merchant class. Riverhold stands at a crossroad, both as a center of trade and a symbol of hope. Adventurers seek out the city to find their path. From this indomitable city, brave souls set out into the Volgelands, seeking a new destiny in a dying world. 
This campaign book is packed with tons of great content. Inside you'll find:
Regional lore concerning the history of the Relicblade world, Riverhold, and the Volgelands.
Faction lore focussing on the Temple of Justice, the Lone Guard, the Battle Pigs, and the sinister Bone and Darkness.
Map based narrative quest lines.
Two dangerous new environments: the Scoured Plains and the Brackish Badlands
Six scenarios in addition to the narrative quest lines.
New wild monsters that inhabit the Volgelands
And optional campaign extras including Side Quests and more!
Just look at this awesome map. Now imagine leading your warriors on this dangerous quest!
There is so much great content in this book! It's a little crazy to focus on one particular aspect, but I can't just upload everything and say "SEE HOW COOL IT IS!!!" with crazy eyes. But look at this dope map! These map based quest lines are great narrative adventures with cool details that bring it all to life. I can't wait for you to play through them.  
Scoured Plains illustration two-page spread.
Also, now that the cards are all in color I may as well make the books full color, right? Here is a preview of the Scoured Plains environment two page spread. Kinda neat, eh?
Included in Adventurer Pledge and Above. Available as an Add-On during this campaign only.
To celebrate the launch of The Volgelands, I sculpted an exclusive miniature of Vandas Greycloak: the Torment of Dusk. Vandas is one of the cruel Dark Wanderers featured in the new book. This miniature will not be available for general release after this Kickstarter Campaign, so be sure that you don't miss out!
The Moldorfs come from a strange dwarven society deep underground. Utterly detached from the surface, these intrepid explorers set out to discover the truth about a mythical world... An "outer land" connected to an infinite "outer space". Though it is surely folly, a powerful hearthguard warrior and a razor sharp rogue join the Bibliothecary on this absurd quest. 
The Moldorf Hearthguard
A titanic underground world exists below our very feet. Immeasurable caverns spread into unknowable depths. Sprawling underground ruins extend into the shadowy abyss. It is from these depths that the Moldorfs emerge.
Moldorf society is ruled by warlords from opposing houses. These households retain an elite core of Hearthguard warriors. In the tight corridors in which the hearthguard fight, they favor the use of massive shields and heavy war spears. From behind their brightly colored and richly decorated pavises, these fighters force their foes into unfavorable positions. 
Tactically keen and lavishly equipped, the few Moldorf Hearthguard to reach the surface have quickly gained renown as formidable warriors.
The Shadowfoot
Shadowfoot belong to secretive clans. They are maniac rogues who stalk the shadowy depths with razor sharp daggers and dubious ambitions. In the complex political alliances between Moldorf houses, there is ample space for these shadowy agents. And though no household would ever admit to employing the Shadowfoot clans, a knife in the dark always has its place.
The quest to discover unknown realms promises both horrors and treasures. The opportunity to test their razor sharp skill is simply irresistible to these rogues. The Shadowfoot are ready to face anything the great unknown can throw at them, but is the greater world ready for them!?
The Moldorf Bibliothecaries
The Moldorf libraries contain countless manuscripts of the forgotten age. Arcane secrets were swallowed by the abyss and utterly lost. But so too, were the Moldorfs. Isolated from the powers that ravage the surface world, the Moldorfs learned magic from ancient texts. A strange wizard caste of librarians, or bibliothecaries, formed around the arcane arts. 
Without the otherworldly patrons or raw creative energy present on the surface, the moldorf studies have naturally emphasized illusion magic. Though illusory magic is far less destructive than other forms, it is no less potent as they manipulate the battlefield. Bibliothecaries sew panic and chaos with massive illusory horrors and dazzling visions.
As the bibliothecaries collected and studied arcane writings, a strange sect began to believe in the existence of a surface world. They insisted the writings were not simply myths, but that they contain a metaphysical truth about the cosmic order. Now, these highly influential illusionists have gathered other bold explorers to their cause. They set out into the unknown. Traveling ever upward holding the ardent belief that a greater world exists in the unknown beyond. 
Neutral Alignment Faction!?
The Moldorfs are a neutral faction. That means any player, good or evil, may add Moldorfs to their party! Isolated underground, the Moldorfs have somehow avoided the cosmic struggle between good an evil. While players must still choose their alignment, neutral characters may be hired by any warband.
Will you influence these strange subterranean explorers for good? Or will you manipulate them to serve your own selfish ambition? I guess we'll see... 
The strange Lostwood stands to the west of Riverhold. It is the source of countless mysteries and haunting legends. The forests shifting boarders mark the boundaries of a most savage wilderness. Lone Guard watches stand vigilantly at its edge. Deep within the Lostwood stands an ancient empire ruled by the exile of the city of the dead, the immortal king Al'Adindred. 
The Lostwood Enclave are a distinct faction who abide by the savage laws of nature. They are wanderers, protectors, and sages of the changed world. Though they are extremely dangerous, their souls are intimately tied to the advocate.
The Arboleth Sentinel
The arboleth are a powerful race of treefolk from deep within the mysterious Lostwood realm. They are slow to anger and deeply wise. Many proud generations have served the immortal king as peacekeepers. They are indomitable warriors naturally attuned with the will of the advocate. These singular beings are lawful, just, and frightfully strong. 
The Wild Elf Pathfinder
Pathfinders are profoundly talented scouts able to navigate the most bewildering lands. They are keen hunters with the senses that reach beyond the physical realms. The wild elves are secretive nomads as a rule, however the pathfinders routinely interact with the greater world. 
On certain foggy nights the Lone Guard are visited by these wanderers. They trade rare goods and exchange rumors before fading away as mysteriously as they came. There are even stories of pathfinders joining noble warriors on dangerous quests. The mist-like visitors lend their unearthly speed and stinging arrows to the righteous endeavor.
Wild Elf Druid and Cave Bear Form
The way of the Druid is a solitary existence. Druids are in communion with nature and abide within its savage laws. They take the shape of a wild beast and may spend years in this form without ever encountering civilization.
The shape of the mighty cave bear is among the most fearsome shapes a druid may choose. These powerful beasts can contend with the horrors and monstrosities that plague the land on equal terms. With tooth and claw these creatures are horrors in their own right.
DRUID CREDIT OPTION:
The druid and bear are original sculpts from the first Relicblade release in 2015. The druid cards have been out of production for the past year, but with the Lostwood set she finds her place in a faction set with updated colored cards. 
2015 to 2018
If you already own the Druid and Bear figures you can opt for $10 credit toward add-ons instead of getting duplicate copies of these figures. You will get the Lostwood set without the druid and bear figures, but still receive the updated druid cards and the new elf and treeman figures. You will have the option to select a credit in the survey after the campaign ends.
In Relicblade, players recruit the ultimate squad of fantasy heroes or cruel villains as they battle for the fate of the world. Choose your path and gather the greatest warriors of the age to your cause! Enter a world of magical treasures, wonders, and horrors. Compete against rivals in the bitter struggle for supremacy! The rules are simple and easy to learn, but players are quickly engaged by deep tactical decisions.
Behold! A disparate band of heroes set upon the path of the Advocate. A Moldorf Shadowfoot, Hellhound Berserker, Arboleth Sentinel, Cleric of Justice, and their Billman Companion.
Relicblade "factions" represent groups that exist within the world. However, when you enter the game as a Seeker you choose between the good or evil alignments and gather heroes or villains to YOUR cause! Players use their influence to recruit characters.
Will you be the fate that brings together a noble fellowship? Or will you bind wicked servants to your dark will!? 
A soldier pig, iguan poacher, ogre retiarius, dark watcher, and shild pig join forces on a dark quest.
Specialize your characters utilizing a vast arsenal of upgrade cards. Tactics, items, weapons, potions, and spells create the framework to customize your characters. Faction sets include a booster pack of cards with new characters and upgrades, so as each new set is released the options continue to grow with dynamic new list-building options. 
In the example below this Iguan Slaver has a combination of defensive and ranged attack upgrades, which shifts his battlefield role and greatly increases his survivability. This particular build includes cards from The Wretched Hive, The Lone Guard, and Adventure Gear card pack.
(some older cards were produced in black and white)
With the Seeker's Handbook campaign rules players construct a base and lead their characters on dangerous adventures to claim magical treasures. There are six scenarios, four environments, dangerous wild monsters, and rare treasures that pack each game with new dangers and unique challenges. The Seeker's Handbook is a wonderful source for limitless adventure. The Volgelands campaign book builds on the core rules in the Seeker's Handbook with tons of exciting new content. 
You can learn a lot more about the game and how it's played on YouTube! There are gameplay overviews, unboxings, and battle reports ready to consume! Ash and Owen of Guerrilla Miniature Games and Gaming With The Cooler played multiple full Relicblade campaigns on their channels. So check it out!
Choose the pledge level that's right for you. I try to offer pledge's suitable for a variety of hobbyists. From the ubiquitous PDF hoarder, to the much beloved completionist. To make things super easy I put the new stuff in one "kickstarter recommended level". 
The "Bold Adventurer" pledge level is the core level for this campaign. It's the perfect level for new and veteran players. With these two faction sets you will be well equipped to enter the dangerous Volgelands. However, players will still need the core rules found in the Seeker's Handbook. You may purchase the book as an Add-on or purchase the book or a pdf right away from Relicblade.com/shop
The Champion of Adventure pledge level will equip you with everything you need for a FOUR PLAYER RELICBLADE CAMPAIGN!!! Is $180 kinda expensive? Sure, it is for me... but it's EVERYTHING you need for up to FOUR players to enter a world of adventure. Good luck getting your gaming group started on a new tabletop miniature game for less :)
Now that you mention it, I spent that much on a single warband earlier this year... So I feel confident that this is an awesome value.
What's a Custom Character Card?
You tell me about a D&D character you used to play or any character you can imagine. Then I will do an original illustration of that character. But the fun won't stop there! I will also stick that character on a special character card and make up some sweet rules and stats for your them! The custom card will be your ideas collaboratively realized in Relicblade. You're welcome to create heroes, villains, relics, or monsters, whatever your heart desires.
You get the digital artwork and copies of your character card along with the other Legends from this campaign. All ten custom character commissions will be collected in the "Legends 4" booster pack. This booster pack will be an official expansion for Relicblade for players to collect and enjoy. The first three Legends sets were extremely popular, so don't miss out on being part of a new generation of legends! 
My sincerest hope is to raise enough money to produce the book and the two faction sets above. But as is Kickstarter tradition, I am happy to add a little wish-list in the form of stretch goals. There will be fewer than last year, but that's just because the core campaign has a heavy workload with an amazing book.
Stretch goals are a great way to boost the project outcomes as the budget increases. If we raise enough money to produce the new sets, then the money we continue to raise will push toward even more new content! Newly unlocked content will be available as Add-Ons once the goal is reached.
Guest Artist: Márk László
The Relicblade: Guest Artist Series RETURNS!! I'm honored to offer another excellent collaboration. As the creator of Relicblade I enjoy unbridled creative freedom. This privilege is granted by my generous Kickstarter Backers, so in this campaign I hope to extend the mantle of creative power to a guest artist! 
I love Márk's style. He and I share a lot of the same influences. His work has tons of character with a mystical edge. He seemed like the perfect person to take my old idea for the Flame Bearer (crazed-fire-wizard) and transform it into something surprising and unique. I'm really delighted with the sketches he's sent so far, and I'm confident we're going to make an AMAZING miniature together!
Card art by Mark Laszlo!
Here is the proposed artwork and specs on the type of shirt we'll be using. 
Volgelands monsters have great art.

Risks and challenges
I have run three successful Kickstarter campaigns to create Relicblade and several expansions. It has been a truly amazing experience. Thanks to the support of backers from around the world I was able to create an extremely high-quality product and continue to run a fruitful business!

I take special care to finish as much as possible before coming to Kickstarter. I lean on my experience to set out a reasonable production schedule to deliver on time. The figures are sculpted and production is under-way. The cards are ready to send to the printer, but without the Kickstarter funds I can't afford to hit "go".

Delays are always possible. 3D printers may break, governments may topple, and trains may derail, but I am confident that I can deliver this product in good order.

Thank you for your continued support!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Ransom City is no more. A missile strike from an unknown origin has turned it to rubble, killing millions in the process.Those that survived emerged from the destruction only to be greeted by V.A.N.D.A.L.; a mysterious mutagen that had terrifying effects on those exposed.
While the government lies destabilized due to the Kingdom’s nefarious activities, the souls trapped in Ransom City have been left to fend for themselves. However, the pharmaceutical giant Parasol Incorporated has taken matters into its own hands and begun to lead cleanup efforts, a decision met with universal praise from the outside world.
Unfortunately, for those within the nightmare, the corporation's arrival has made things worse. Their interests seem skewed, their actions are questionable, and since their "efforts" have begun, people have disappeared, strange mutated creatures have crawled out of the shadows, and what can only be described as monsters straight out of horror movies have begun to run rampant.
Now, it is time for the survivors to fight. Fight for the truth ... and their futures.
Aftershock is a deluxe expansion for the Street Masters board game, adding four new fighter decks, four new stage decks, two new enemy decks, new loot cards, and much more! Expanding on the modular nature of Street Masters, Aftershock includes two new ways to customize your play experience: missions and showdowns.
The mission deck is included to speed up multiplayer games by adding additional ways to support your fellow fighters. Mission cards allow fighters to gain powerful mission tokens, that can in turn be used to assist your fellow fighters during their turn.
Showdowns are a new type of story deck that can be used in any story mode game, adding a villainous character working in the shadows against the fighters. Each showdown deck introduces a unique story for the associated enemy deck, as well as upgrade cards that will truly test the fighters!
Players can also choose to include these enemy upgrade cards in their arcade games to increase difficulty and customize their games even further.
Additionally, Aftershock comes packed in a massive storage box that is designed to hold all existing Street Masters decks and tokens, as well as room for future content.
 Find out more about the products in the Aftershock Tier: Aftershock (Details Part 1), Aftershock (Details Part 2), Essence of Evil
Find out more about the products in the Street Masters Tier: Street Masters, Legend of Oni, KS1 Stretch Goals
Click here to see us unbox the original Kickstarter lineup!
Street Masters is a 1-4 player cooperative miniatures board game inspired by classic beat ‘em up & fighting video games. Featuring over 65 highly detailed miniatures, unique decks for fighters & enemies, custom dice, and lightning-fast gameplay, Street Masters lets players match up powerful fighters against villainous organizations in a wide array of exciting stages.
Designed by Adam Sadler and Brady Sadler, the game offers modular and elegant gameplay set in a unique world of street brawling action!

Like many other publishers, we will be charging for shipping after the Kickstarter concludes, based on the actual costs incurred to ship. We will collect this via our pledge manager after the campaign ends. This is so we can be fair to you all since final shipping sizes are unpredictable with a growing campaign. This also gives us more room for stretch goals and as much cool gameplay stuff as possible.
After manufacturing, we'll ship your rewards at our cost to our international hubs. The following is a rough estimate for shipping a standard game package (approx. 4kg volumetric weight). Keep in mind these are just estimates, and costs may rise based on weight increases from unlocked stretch goals and any add-ons you choose.
USA: $10-$20 to most states ($50 to Alaska, Hawaii, and Puerto Rico).
CANADA: $12-$23 to most cities.
LATIN AMERICA: $70-$80 to most countries ($90 to Brazil).
ASIA: $15-20 to China and Hong Kong. $30 to most other countries; note that we cannot provide an estimated cost to Malaysia, Singapore, or Indonesia though they will be sent from China).
OCEANIA: $20-$35 to Australia. $30 to New Zealand. 
AFRICA: $95 to most countries.
EUROPE: $20-$35 to most countries. $30-$40 to Norway, Finland, Estland, Lettland, and Latvia. $50 to Bosnia/Herzegovina, Croatia, and Serbia. $55 to Bulgaria, Lithuania, and Romania. $60 to Iceland. $45 to Greece and Turkey. $70-$80 to Israel, and Liechtenstein. $90 to Belarus.
Unfortunately, different import laws and customs from some specific countries have made it impossible for our shipping/fulfillment partner to ship to there, such as Russia, Ukraine, Kazakhstan and Afghanistan. Due to this, we will not ship to these areas.
REFUND POLICY
We can refund you within 2 weeks (14 days) of the campaign’s end date, fees included. After that, we will accept returns minus the Kickstarter and payment processing fees (which we cannot get back from them after 14 days). However, once we complete manufacturing and are readying our inventory to be placed on boats to our regional hubs, no refunds are possible. All refunds taking place within 14 days of the close of the campaign are reversed via Stripe to your credit card. Refunds taking place 14 days after the close of the campaign may be processed via PayPal or reversed via Stripe to your credit card, at our discretion. This project is being funded in USD and any refunds processed will be in USD for the exact amount received in USD, excluding any applicable fees depending on the time of the refund being processed.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Following our successful campaigns for Street Masters and Brook City, we are continuing to learn about how better to improve our marketing, design, manufacturing, fulfillment, and distribution, as well as how best to nurture our growing community. Street Masters was fulfilled in June/July 2018 and has since received critical acclaim, resulting in it selling out. Thus this Kickstarter's theme is not only to offer new content and a great (and highly demanded) storage solution, but also to print more inventory from our first campaign’s product lineup, giving backers a chance to get all of the things they missed the first time around, as well as allow us to get non-exclusive items to mass retail.

Currently, Brook City is in production at the manufacturer. Per our recent updates, we've approved all samples and they are in mass production, about 5 months early! Though we aren't physically involved until mass production is finished, it's equally important that we continue to communicate with them and our backers in order to provide the latest updates and news. Aftershock is extremely exciting, but we are also just as excited and committed to bringing Brook City to our backers' tabletops as soon as possible.

There are a lot of moving parts with Kickstarter campaigns, and timing is often one of the biggest obstacles, especially for smaller publishers such as ourselves. Fortunately, we've got experienced game designers working hard to ensure the gameplay offers the best experience it can, we have strong relationships with the factory/manufacturer, we have a shipment/fulfillment company already signed on, we are completely passionate about our games, and, most importantly, we care about our backers and their satisfaction.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Here's the layout for the medium Sketch Wallet
Here's the layout for the small Sketch Wallet
Your wish is granted! 
We've come out with two new smaller Sketch Wallets. Our original Sketch Wallet is 4x6 inches and the most requested feature since we came out with the canvas wallet was to make a smaller version. We've made not one, but two smaller versions. The medium wallet is roughly 4x4.5 inches and the small is 3.5x4 inches. We know what you're thinking, are they too small to draw or write in? No. The medium wallet sketchbooks are roughly 3.5 inches square and are great to draw or write in. Everybody loves to draw or take notes on Post-It Notes and these books are larger than those, plus the square format is great for posting to Instagram :-) The small Sketch Wallet books are 2.5x3.75 which are slightly bigger than a standard sketch card. It's a fun size to draw or write in while making it a great size for even a front pocket. Each version comes in black or brown leather or black or gray canvas. Plus we threw in a tweed version just for fun. Keeping our vegan friends in mind, we picked a herringbone pattern tweed that is made from cotton, not wool. The space for the pencil or pen is actually larger than our original size wallet opening up many possibilities for new tools to carry.
Medium leather wallets come in black or brown
Medium fabric wallets come in brown tweed, black and gray canvas
Small leather wallets coming in brown or black leather
Small fabric wallets come in brown tweed or black and gray canvas
 If you're new to Sketch Wallet...
Sketch Wallet is a great way to always have your sketchbook with you. Or if you're the kind of person that would rather take quick notes on good old fashioned paper, this is the best way to do that. These wallet-sized books aren't intended to replace your full-sized sketchbooks or notebooks but are great for sketching or writing on the go when inspiration strikes. I've come to rely on mine and can't live without it.

campaign.story:
Welcome to Litchmyre Dungeon, the home of a new range of detailed resin and metal fantasy miniatures, which ooze nostalgia and classic goodness. Zealot is back with our third Kickstarter, bringing to life this new range, with our usual reputation for quality and jaw-droppingly detailed miniatures.
Back in 2014 we created a new level of Dungeon scenery, using digital production methods and detailed vacuum casting. Then last year, we breathed new life into a too-long forgotten fantasy race, the Minotaurs, which we are finishing the delivery of now - with delighted backers praising the detail and quality.
This time, we wanted to go back to our roots and tackle real heroes and villains, characters which capture our imaginations and make us remember why we started gaming or collecting.
We are heavily inspired by classic RPG games; playing old fantasy games from the 80s is what started all this madness in the first place!
So welcome to a fusion of past and present, new and old. We are updating, modernizing and offering to you, this range of high quality miniatures traditionally sculpted by the awesome miniature artist, Boris Woloszyn.
If you like what you see; Read on, brave adventurer.
 We don't produce board game counters, these are not PVC pencil toppers, injection moulded in china  - we make Miniatures. Resin and Metal, these are produced the same as they were 30 years ago, cutting no corners and not skimping on quality or detail. It's not the fastest or cheapest process, but it certainly is the best. If you want Miniatures which you will cherish and still want to use in another 30 years time, then these are for you.
 We have teamed up with Boris Woloszyn, a traditional putty sculptor from Brazil, these models are made by hand, no 3D printing involved (unusually for us!). Boris has a real talent as an artist, able to bring true character to each sculpt, I'm sure you will agree.
These models are heavily inspired by the classic games we grew up loving and playing with our families and friends. Just take a look at the greens, all made from putty.
Production of Boris's sculpts is done in three materials, Standard Resin, White Metal and Premium Resin. As we unlock each material in the stretch goals, you will have a choice to add which material you want.
Standard Resin is one for the gamer, it is on par with a lot of other companies' resin materials, the details are good but the resin is not as tough and flexible as the Premium offering. There will be more splits and parts for each model when they are produced in this material.
White Metal, that fabled shiny material which is fondly remembered by older gamers. When your army weighed more than a cinder block and dropping a Dragon model on your toes resulted in a trip to the hospital.
It's for the gamer or painter who wants a shot of nostalgia, feeling the weight in their hands. The details are good, the models are tough and it paints well. White metal does have more gates and vents to clean up from the model than resin models.
Premium Resin is really a superior resin. It requires very few gates and vents, has a nice matte surface to paint, has 0.2% shrinkage and captures every detail of the original sculpt perfectly. It is tougher than Standard Resin with some flex to avoid damage. It cuts and files well when cleaning the model up or converting.
Premium resin is the material for the serious painter or collector.
 All of the pledges you can supplement with "Add Ons" from the section below.
Miniatures come in three tiers 'Hero Sized', 'Mighty Sized' and 'Monstrous Sized'. Green, Blue and Yellow Dots respectively.
Scenery by our friends at Manor House Workshop, Forgotten Halls
You can add to your pledge with any of the following packs. Just increase your pledge by the amount needed.
To see each scenery piece in better detail, you can view them in our store by clicking here.
Here is a gallery for each of the core Miniatures, stretch goal models can bee seen in the section below. The coloured dot on each image, indicates if they are "Hero Sized", "Mighty Sized" or "Monstrous Sized".
Each model will come with a standard Plastic Round Base or Classic Rectangle base, as shown in the pictures. You can make your selection on the Pledge Manager after the campaign closes.
Scenery by our friends at Manor House Workshop, 3DBases
 As funding progresses we will unlock stretch goals and extra miniatures. Below you can see what has been unlocked and what is the next goal coming up. The coloured dot on each image refers to the size. Green "Hero Size", Blue "Mighty Size" and Orange "Monstrous Size".
We are splitting the production into three tiers with the three types of material on offer. This should allow us to deliver to our deadlines as the load on each manufacturing method is reduced. Currently we have marked July 2019 as the delivery for this project. 
Since this is a traditionally sculpted project, Boris requires around 1 week to complete each additional sculpt, depending on how many stretch goals are unlocked, this could take a fair few months for him to complete the sculpting. You cant rush this kind of art!
If this is the case and we hit a lot of the planned stretch goals, we are happy to offer a split dispatch option, where the core models are dispatched early - since they are already in moulds and not far off mass production. There will be no problem delivering core models before the dispatch date.
Then the stretch goal sculpts will follow some months later in wave 2.
Due to the manufacture method of vacuum cast resin and spincast metals, dispatch date will depend a lot on amount that we fund. We will update this section once funding is underway and we have a better idea for how popular this will be. We do dispatch on a rolling backer ID system.
It may be possible to dispatch Standard Resin core miniatures ahead of the predicted delivery date.
Scenery by our friends at Manor House Workshop, 3DBases
MAXIMUM Postage Costs
These are the MAXIMUM postage costs for a large pledge. For example a pledge of 50 models in White metal would be these values. 50 models in resin, the postage is around half these values.
Postage costs start at the values which are stated on each pledge (£3 UK, £4 EU and £5 Rest of World) If you add more models and Add ons, postage costs will increase with weight. The end postage will be calculated by the pledge manager after the campaign end.
Please note, metal models are around 4 times as heavy as resin.
The end postage costs will be calculated on the Pledge Manager, but they will not exceed the postage values in the table below. These include tracked and signed for shipping.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We will produce a new range of quality resin and metal Heroes and Monsters. The risks to this project are very minimal. We do this kind of production, every day for 8 years, producing miniatures for many high profile companies. All the core set of models are already ready to start mass manufacture. 

We are not new to Kickstarter; our first Kickstarter was a colossal project ~200k resin cast pieces.
We delivered it and it was highly praised that "the quality was beyond amazing" and the detail was "phenomenal". Certainly achieving what we set out; to bring a new level of cutting edge dungeon scenery to gamers.
Our second project, the Minotaur Horde, we are on track to deliver the last few hundred backers inside the next 2 months, and again the feedback was overwhelmingly positive by everyone receiving their pledge. 

Risk#1: Speed of manufacture.
Resin and Spincast Metal are labor intensive materials to cast with. If there are many stretch goals which we hit, then Boris will need more time to sculpt them. This will push back the start of manufacture. 

While there will be no problem delivering the core models by the estimated date. If the project funds well and many goals are hit - then we will offer a split shipping option, so core models are delivered on time, then stretch goal models get delivered in a wave 2 a few months later. 

Aside from the risk of delayed dispatch of stretch goals, the risks are very minimal.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Strong, brave, probably a little more than slightly insane, the barbarian is the first tool in the arsenal of any self respecting megalomaniacal sorcerer hell bent to take over the world. Or in the warband of any ambitious Warlord seeking fame and fortune gold and glory!
Like walking piles of muscle held together by leather and chains and random plates of battered metal, the barbarian flings himself into the fray frothing at the mouth and shouting unintelligible obscenities. God knows they tend to die a lot so you'll need a lot of them.....so here we are!
Red Box Games makers of awesomely designed, exquisitely sculpted and expertly cast fine fantasy 28mm scale miniatures is very proud to present!!
WARBANDS OF WRATH AND RUIN
With your generous support we hope to fund the production of a series of new, finely detailed and beautifully sculpted, expertly produced," 28 mm " scale barbarian miniatures which are the initial warband starter set for an all new small scale skirmish game set in a brutal, fallen fantasy world ruled by capricious Living Gods and beset by the ravages of their eternal war for survival and supremacy. The rules for the game are not quite ready for print yet but it is the goal of this campaign to fund this initial set of figures which will help us to also afford to finish the rules and get the production process for the rules and game components started.
In the game, Players take on the role of a powerful characters of super human or preternatural nature called " Chosen " in command of a small band of followers of various role and ability. These warbands , referred to in game as the " Following " expand in number and diversity as the Warlord grows in Power, Repute, Fortune and Favor of the Gods beginning in number between 6 and 9 followers, but growing to include as many as 24 followers at the Apex of the Chosen's Stature.
FOLLOWERS
These followers may be lowly slaves, cultists, warriors, champions, and even monsters. But the core of any Chosen's following are the foot warriors.
FOOT WARRIORS
The foot warriors are the most basic type of warrior follower. They are sparely equipped and basically trained and able. They are non specific to the character of their Chosen and can be of many different races or creature types but the first set of Foot Warriors we want to fund are the Human foot warriors. Rippling muscle and ready to slay in the name of any Chosen whose coin can fill their bowl or whose stature warrants following. 
Pictured here still somewhat WIP these figures are semi modular for VERY expansive customization options and are cast in a very high quality lead free white metal. All modular fittings will be made in such a way as to insure easy secure assembly.
The items included in the pack are;
10 barbarian foot warrior head / helm options
6 right hand weapon options
3 heavy weapon options
3 heavy weapon foot warrior bodies
5 weapon and shield foot warrior bodies
All this in one set for $40.00!! High quality, finely detailed metal minis for $5.00 Each!
 SOLOS
Solos include both the companions and the Chosen themselves. These are the characters of the stories with the companions acting as a supporting role to the Chosen. Please note that any one of the foot warriors can be selected as a Solo option. 
PRIESTESS
The Priestess is a companion follower who serves as an intermediary between the Chosen and one of the Patron Gods of the world. Each Priestess is different and their uses can vary wildly based on the particular choices made during the creation of the character for use in the game but rest assured in this game a Chosen without some sort of spiritual aid is a Chosen set upon an arduous path.
Pictured here as a WIP the Priestess will be available in 2 different forms. One unclad and one half clad. The image above represents her unclad form. Her clad form will be slightly more modest.
Backers can add additional copies of the Priestess to their existing pledge for an additional $8 per copy desired.
Backers can also pledge for the Priestess figure ONLY if they so choose for $8 per copy desired.
LESSER CHOSEN
Currently still WIP the Chosen will be finished very soon!
The Chosen are the scions of the Gods. Born from any strata of denizen in the realms these few are half mortal and half God, able to draw upon the ethereal energies of the cosmos to fuel superhuman feats of strength, speed, skill or to perform miraculous manipulations of the world around them. They can be man or woman marked by the touch of divinity with strange colored skin, hair, eyes, super human, or inhuman build or feature.
 Backers can add additional copies of Chosen to their existing pledge for an additional $8 per copy desired.
 Backers can also pledge for the Chosen figure(s) ONLY if they so choose for $8 per copy desired.
PLEDGES
 As the funding allows I WILL add more options to the campaign. These will include Chosen of different nature to lead the Foot Warriors and companions of different role and nature to aid these Chosen in their quest for power, survival, glory, favor and fortune. I do not anticipate being able to add other foot warrior types to this campaign BUT I DO have plans for other various types of foot warrior to expand the range of theme of the game through future campaigns if this campaign does not reach a level of funding to allow them to be added during this campaign.
Backers are free to add as many sets of foot warrior as they desire. This is accomplished by simply managing the amount of their pledge upward by enough value to cover multiple sets.
STRETCH GOALS
It is our hope to be able to expand the total offering of this campaign to include Chosen and Companions of different character such as an Amazon, a Mutant, a Beast Man, and a Hoplite, as well as a Sorceror, Sorceress, Priestess and Mystic as well as different head options for the Human foot warriors, and possibly other foot warrior themes as well! We can only do this as funding allows however and we will need to cover the costs of each new addition BEFORE it is a selectable add-on or substitution.
PRODUCTION
We have been producing miniatures in metal and resin for a long time..... 10 years actually. And in that time we have established strong stable partnerships with some of the best contractors in the industry. This project will be handled by one of those awesome professionals as well insuring promptly delivered awesomeness so that you can get started playing your games while the excitement is still fresh! This contractor is VERY well established in the industry having delivered in a timely fashion to high levels of quality on several very large products including many of my own Kickstarter projects. Their system of manufacture is very well tested and efficient to make sure that delivery is handled swiftly. And being based in the US this means no lengthy delays in delivery, and no unexpected complications in that process.
SHIPPING
We will not accept any payment for postage through the kickstarter. So please be aware that all of the money you add to your pledge WILL be applied to a reward selection and NOT to the postage needed to cover the shipment of your rewards. I have learned the hard way several times that trying to predict the postage costs of rewards packages can very easily become a serious problem. 
You will be billed for postage during the pledge manager phase of fulfillment which will be very shortly before delivery commences. We work to keep the postage costs as low as possible and we will be certain that your rewards are securely packaged so as to avoid any damage in transit.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I have been working in the miniatures industry since 2006 and have been operating my own business producing miniatures since 2008. In that time I have produced several hundred different unique figures and shipped thousands of packages around the world. I have also established very close working relationships with several of the best contractors in the business.
There are always certain risks in any production but I feel that with my experience and relationships I can confidently say there is very minimal risk involved in this kickstarter due to the sheer amount of experience I have in making minis and the reliability and experience of my casting contractor. There may be certain fixes needed for optimal casting of the figures and there may be production delays as these fixes are made. If the project's scope grows beyond the initial offering it could also result in further delays as all fo the product is readied for delivery. The most reasonable risk I could assume worth being worries about would be a delay in postage or a sudden drastic increase in postage costs. An Increase in postage costs is VERY unlikely though as the time frame between funding and delivery on this project will be very short.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Forgotten World is Fireforge Games newest project.    
Our intent is to bring to life an entire new range of fantasy models, perfect for your fantasy wargames and roleplaying campaigns.  
Fireforge Games is an italian company with expertise in the creation and distribution of multi-part 28mm, miniature figures. Our products are made with Hard Plastic (HIP – High Impact Polystyrene) or resin to assemble and paint. The production of our kits will take place in the EU, completely under our quality control.  
Here at Fireforge, our employees are passionate and long-time wargamers and hobbyists, and this passion is the main motivation behind our work. Our goal is to give you (and ourselves of course), fun and entertainment with our figures and games.  
This Kickstarter campaign seeks funds to release six units for the first two Forgotten World's factions; the Northmen and the Living Dead. Below you will find a complete description of all the plastic kits, which will be released upon a successful Kickstarter; including our future available options and many pictures of assembled and painted figures, representing the final product.
LATEST NEWS
What will you get with your pledge? Check our list
Note: now General pledge will take as freebies both the KS esclusive figures
 More Add-ons? Check our fantasy football range in our add-on section!
We uploaded the first part of the alpha version for Forgotten World rules. Remember that rules are still work in progress and the alpha version is just to show you on what we are working. In this first part you will get the basic rules for Forgotten World - Conquerors rules that are focused on battles between regimented units.
Download the alpha HERE
The Northmen 
The Northern Kingdom is one of the strongest and largest nations of the New World. Once a united country, led by an ancient dynasty, now it is divided between generals, lords and rich merchants; assembling their own armies to conquer the throne. Any Northmen army can count on an excellent core of warriors, expert soldiers without fear of the enemy, with a good number of bowmen, who with their arrow fire, cover the advance of their warrior brethren. The flanks of a Northmen army are usually protected by fast units of mounted men at arms, usually bodyguards of the local vassal and act perfectly as scouts or to chase a routed enemy.
Picture above shows prototypes assembled and painted
NORTHMEN WARRIORS - 12 models
Box content: 
1x Command frame 
2x Warriors frames 
1x unit card with skills and equipment list
12x 20mm square bases and 12x 25mm diameter round bases 
This box will allow you to assemble 12 figures; up to 12 spearmen OR up to 12 swordsmen OR up to 6 with two handed spears. The Command options will allow you to assemble one Leader, one Musician and one Standard Bearer. 
Figures are supplied unpainted and require some assembly.
The following video shows the assembly of a Northmen warrior.
PLAY

Picture above shows prototypes assembled and painted
                                     NORTHMEN BOWMEN- 12 models
Box content: 
1x Command frame 
2x Bowmen frames 
1x unit card with skills and equipment list
12x 20mm square bases and 12x 25mm diameter round bases 
This box will allow you to assemble 12 figures; up to 12 with an arrow in the right hand, up to 6 bowmen that just released the arrow; up to 6 arrows can be assembled with flaming tips, and up to 4 models with a hood covering the head. The Command options will allow you to assemble one Leader, one Musician and one Standard Bearer. 
Figures are supplied unpainted and require some assembly.
Picture above shows prototypes assembled and painted
NORTHMEN CAVALRY- 6 models
Box content: 
1x Command frame 
2x Cavalry frames 
1x unit card with skills and equipment list
6x 25x50mm square bases and 6 75x43mm oval bases 
This box will allow you to assemble 6 mounted figures; up to 6 with sword OR up to 6 with lances. You can assemble up to 6 figures with shields OR up to 6 figures holding reins. The Command options will allow you to assemble one Leader, one Musician and one Standard Bearer. Horses come with 3 different pairs of half-bodies with 3 different heads and 3 different tails (you will have 27 different horse configurations). 
Figures are supplied unpainted and require some assembly.
The Living Dead
When the plague first appeared in the Old World, it spread rapidly, bringing death among the weak nations of the East; now being reduced to little more than ruins. It did not take long before the disease began to spread in the New World. But the rumors about the plague had already alarmed the kingdoms of the west very few of them fall prey to the Living Dead. Many years have passed since then, the kingdoms of the west are weakened by rivalries and internal struggles for power while the living dead led by the now undead kings of the past era have begun to spread their influence. The most isolated villages easily fall prey to the contagion, while necromancers use their dark powers to raise the remains of ancient warriors, from battlefields long forgotten into the service of their dead kings. And when the full moon arrives, and the magic of death is strengthened, the knights of death are unleashed on the earth for the harvest ...
Picture above shows prototypes assembled and painted
LIVING DEAD WARRIORS- 12 models
Box content: 
2x Warriors frames 
1x unit card with skills and equipment list
12x 20mm square bases and 12x 25mm diameter round bases 
This box will allow you to assemble 12 figures; up to 12 spearmen OR up to 6 with two handed spears OR up to 8 swordsmen OR up to two with war axe OR up to two with war maces. The Command options will allow you to assemble two Leaders, two Musicians and two Standard Bearers. 
Figures are supplied unpainted and require some assembly.
The following video shows the assembly of a Living Dead Warrior.
PLAY

Picture above shows prototypes assembled and painted
                                   LIVING DEAD PEASANTS- 18 models
Box content: 
3x Peasants frames 
1x unit card with skills and equipment list
18x 20mm square bases and 18x 25mm diameter round bases 
This box will allow you to assemble 18 figures; up to three with the same type of weapons, like pitchforks, cleavers, scythes, hoes, shovels, big axes and butcher knives OR up to 9 with open hands. 
Figures are supplied unpainted and require some assembly.
Picture above shows prototypes assembled and painted
LIVING DEAD KNIGHTS - 6 models
Box content: 
2x Knights frames 
2x Horse frame 
1x unit card with skills and equipment list
6x 25x50mm square bases and 6x 75x43mm oval bases. 
This box will allow you to assemble 6 mounted figures; up to 6 with sword OR up to 6 with lances OR up to two figures with axes OR up to two figures with maces OR up to two figures with morning star and two dogs. Bardings are separate, you can assemble the horses with or without them. The Command options will allow you to assemble two Leaders, two Musicians and two Standard Bearers. Horses come with three different pairs of half-bodies with three different heads and three different tails (you will have 27 different horse positions). 
Figures are supplied unpainted and require some assembly.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
THE COMPANY 
Fireforge Games is an Italian manufacturer of figures for tabletop games. 
Our work began in 2011 with the production of multi-part plastic and resin figures for historical, medieval, wargames with the intention to release the best figures possible. 
Our company strives to release high-quality products, focusing on aesthetic poses, accurate details and numerous choices for customers to assemble our figures. 
Fireforge has a long and proven relationship with our customers. We sell our products anywhere in the world and our policy is that we are hobbyists before merchants. 
Customers can always count on the support of our company for any problems or mistakes with Fireforge's products. We readily listen to customer feedback and requests.

THE PRODUCT 
Figures shown in this campaign will be produced in the EU Community. 

REFUND POLICY
Fireforge Games is able to refund backers within 14 days of the campaign’s end, fees included. A refund request after this period will only be processed through PayPal. In this case we will refund the amount paid deducting Kickstarter's fees. 
No refund will be possible anymore during the period while our company will inform backers that will start to package the pledges.
This project is being funded in EURO and any refunds processed will be in EU for the exact amount received in EU, excluding any applicable fees depending on the time of the refund being processed.


TERMS AND CONDITIONS

At the end of the campaign we will ask, by Kickstarter, your billing and shipping details and your phone number to help with a successful delivery. This information is necessary to send you the products of your pledge. Without any answer to these requests for information, we will not send the product and we will not take responsibility for any delay in sending your order. 
Under your request, we will be able to change the address for the shipment of your pledge until the announcement that we will start to package the products. 
We also will accept replacement requests in the case of missing or damaged products until two months after you received the tracking and shipping e-mail.

If you do not accept these terms, please do not pledge on this project and instead wait for the official release.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
