[Voting phase 1: Till 9th,  Eastern Time 11:59 PM]
[Voting phase 2: You can STILL vote for your favourite Special Knife [HMG, Long sword, Sniper gun, Shotgun, or Handgun] in C-Wars private forum. (will be accessible after KS)]
[The final weapon data may VARY in the game. ]
Swiss Army Knife : With the screwdrivers, you can deactivate some enemy's turrets. 
Garden Trowel : You harvest crystal faster, way faster...
We love apocalyptic themes (not in real life, of course!), and have been thinking about the best way to integrate themes of desperation, chaos, and hope into one game. This isn’t just about simple storytelling or displaying a crisis in front of you; it’s our invitation to you to enter into and interact with this world.
C-Wars is a roguelike game. Its gameplay allows you to explore this cyberpunk apocalypse in your own way. 
Roguelike is retro but not old fashioned, especially when embedded with an original combat system.
In addition to the numerous special/random encounters commonly seen in a regular roguelike game, we’ve spent a large amount of time creating this unique combat system, which follows an RTS spirit with an ARPG essence. Our goal is to amplify units collaboration and micromanagement.
It's a magnificent combination of retro-style visuals and innovative gameplay.
A global nuclear war reset humankind, and Luna base became the final outpost of civilization. 150 years later, Alpha, the largest Luna city, was infected by Crystal mutants. Despite all the precautions taken, the infection broke the quarantine barrier and hit Delta City.
Luna Council decided to use tactical nuclear weapons to terminate the two cites. You, as Sector 7's field commander, must enter these infected areas and find out the truth before it's too late. Your decisions in the game will determine Luna's fate. 
You can cooperate with LDF to set up tactical nuclear bombs and wipe out the infected people...but many innocent lives will be lost in the process. 
Eliminate Cyber-Lover, the mafia army, to steal their research on the Crystal Clan...but you can't unveil the dark truth behind this outbreak yet.
Or, you could choose the hardest option: fight your way out to reach the core of Alpha City, retrieve the fatal data from the old Sector 6 Research facility, and convince the Council to stop their termination.
Luna's fate depends on you, our final hope. 
Now, go, save mankind! 
Explore two huge cities progressively and check as many spots as you can...but remember, you are running out of time. Luna Council is about to nuke these cities.
Your decision matters and can change Luna world’s fate. Different endings, rich encounters. Can you save Delta?
RTS on blocks?
On the battle field, you need blue blocks to summon backups. Don't panic if enemies take them away, because you can always get them back. 
Your backups are summoned soldiers. They will attack when they can, but you are responsible for their lives. Make sure to move them to the best tactical positions in realtime. Your captain will wait for your order to attack, just as in old-school ARPGs. 
The combat system looks quite busy, but it will never be chaotic. You can pause whenever you want. 
Plus, if you pledge "More Hero," you will have a supremely powerful captain on your side from the beginning, so you have nothing to worry about (this hidden hero will not ruin your game, we promise!).
Beat the game your own way.
Over 20 units from 4 different organizations. You can also deploy turrets and special units to fight. Try them all and have fun!
Now that’s the tactic we’re talking about. Collaborate your units!
You may install up to 3 skills on each hero to produce the best team for combats.
Collect special weapons for your heroes, and mass produce them for your army. 
Snatch BOSS' weapons in special encounters!
Collect surprise items. Not only can they help you on the battle field, but they also contain the key to some special encounters.
You have the chance to induce enemy bosses to be your captains. Gotta catch 'em ALL!
We’ve spent a lot of time on crafting the animations, and designed every move with the utmost care.
The Making-of Onipunks' pixel animation
Concept art, Draft, and Anime sheet 
Sprite sheet
Our self-developed engine ensures better performance. Small reminder: ONI-engine packed 800+ pixel animations into 1Megabyte, about half the size of a photo taken with your phone. 
The Making-of: ONI-engine dev-kits demo
Although the theme song of C-Wars is a magnificent symphony, C-Wars itself is a pixel PC game. Therefore, composer Eddy Liu wrote most melodies in retro style. Don’t be surprised if you find the original soundtrack of C-Wars to be a mixture of symphony and MIDI music.  
How much have we completed on C-Wars?
With the support of seed money, we were able to complete the ONI-Engine and tons of animations in the past 3 years. Now, however, more help is required for us to finish the game. What we’re asking for on Kickstarter is approximately 15% of the total development cost. Your contribution will provide us not only more financial support but also confidence. Show us that YOU want this game from us. 
How your KS contribution will be used：
Luna got some help from this awesome INDIE community! 
We are honored to present our 3 awesome indie friends. They sent their most powerful heroes to help us in this mutant outbreak.

campaign.story:
WHO IS RON JOCKMAN?
My name is Ron Jockman. I am certainly not the greatest Science Fiction author there ever was, but I'm very close to the top of the list. Why? It's because of the story I have to tell. Also, I'm a damned good author.
My book series is about the Universe's greatest hero: John Rockman. Enemies fear him, friends like him, and women want him.
WHO IS THE REAL RON JOCKMAN?
Ok, here's the deal: Ron Jockman is a fictional author. He was created by myself, Justin Lucas, and my twin brother Mitchell Lucas as a satirical representation of many Science Fiction and Fantasy authors that live vicariously through their heroes and inject their ridiculous philosophies into their work. He is socially inept, selfish, misogynistic, opinionated, and an awful writer.
Several years ago we wrote a science fiction short story, it was purposely generic and absolutely ridiculous. It broke just about every rule we could think of that an author is supposed to follow. I distinctly remember crying from laughter at what we were putting into that short story. Later, it would become something much larger.
WHAT ARE THE ROCKMAN CHRONICLES?
The Rockman Chronicles is a Satirical Science Fiction Adventure book trilogy currently being written by myself, Justin Lucas, and my brother, Mitchell Lucas, in which the heroic (and hairy) John Rockman must inspire hope, save innocent people, and kill bad guys. . . the catch is, it is written through an idiotic author character we created named Ron Jockman. The story itself is not the satire, it's the author behind the work.
We are avid Science Fiction and Fantasy fans which is why we wrote this story. We have noticed certain authors, who shall remain nameless, like to use the main characters of their novels as beautified versions of themselves. The main character is almost worshiped by the supporting characters that surround him, as they agree with his ridiculous opinions, listen in awe at his obscure philosophies, or utterly respect his bizarre fetishes. This is exactly what we exploit.
In The Rockman Chronicles, we write what makes us laugh. Some of the time we don't know why we laugh at the things we type, we just find this stuff funny, and we hope you will, too.
Here is a sample chapter from John Rockman and the Trials of Galactar by the Prince of Galactar to get an idea of what type of story we wish to tell:
Sample Chapter: A Virtual Danger
We love to conceptualize and develop. We are creators. Together, with our talents, my brother and I try to make just about everything ourselves. Here, check out the trailers we did for the first two eBooks:
HOW MUCH WORK IS LEFT?
The first book in the trilogy, John Rockman and the Trials of Galactar by the Prince of Galactar was released last year, the second book, John Rockman and the Cosmic Brain of Corruption, is about half done, and work on John Rockman and the Keys of the Void has not yet begun. So the entire project is about at the mid-way mark.
WHERE WILL THE FUNDS GO?
The funds will be used for finishing, editing, production, delivery and advertising. Simple right?
We want to be able to get these books out to the people. We don't currently have the means to get the books to the quality we think they deserve. It may be a purposely-bad book, but we don't desire a purposely-bad product. We take a lot of care in the words we choose even if it doesn't seem that way, and we want to make some quality products for the people that enjoy them.
THE REWARDS
For all pledges at $15 and higher, you will get three ZIP files containing a PDF, a MOBI, and an EPUB of each of the three books. Right off the bat you will get the finished Trials of Galactar ZIP file and the other two will be released to our backers the moment they are finished.
For a $25 and $30 pledge, you will get a Kickstarter-only Rockman Chronicles Supernova Trilogy Edition novel with your name printed in a special acknowledgement section, in addition to the three eBook bundles. In this single novel, you will get all three ridiculous tales (Trials of Galactar, Cosmic Brain of Corruption, and Keys of the Void), one right after another, all bound in one solitary volume with your name printed in the acknowledgement section of the novel! Impress your friends with your easy-to-carry trilogy book while they try desperately to carry all of their separate, individual books.
For a $45 pledge, you will get all previous rewards, PLUS the complete digital audiobook of the first novel of the trilogy, John Rockman and the Trials of Galactar by the Prince of Galactar voiced by co-author Mitchell Lucas with a few additional voices by myself, Justin Lucas, and our good friend Chris Hall.
Not too sure of the quality? I don't blame you. If you want to know what he sounds like, just check out the sample chapter audio version and find out for yourself.
For a $60 pledge, in addition to the eBook bundles and the Kickstarter-only Rockman Chronicles Supernova Trilogy Edition, you can just cut right to the chase and get the final two novels in digital audiobook form. The ENTIRE trilogy, voiced by the authors themselves. You will hear it as it was meant to be heard. You can learn all the weird pronunciations and show off to your mom/friends/mom's friends.

PLAY CHASM DEMO 1.05!
Windows: Download (Requires XNA 4.0 runtime)

NOTE: We'd love to do every single goal listed here regardless of the amount raised, but we will be constrained by both time and money. If we don't reach a listed goal, that doesn't necessarily mean it won't be in the game. These targets are just a way to ensure you that it will be in the final copy on release day. We will do everything in our power to get every single one of them in. They are ordered roughly by amount of content & time required, as well as how much longevity they will add to the gameplay.
$160,000 - Extended Soundtrack - A digital double album: one of remixes, the other of demos, out-takes and unused material.
$175,000 - Achievements - Challenging Achievements to obtain in all versions of the game. These won't be awarding you for pressing jump!
$200,000 - Arena Mode - Battle waves of enemies and bosses in an arena for unique items after you complete the main game.
$215,000 - Crafting - Search for long-lost recipes of rare items, and the difficult to obtain ingredients to craft them.
$230,000 - Roguelike Mode - Challenge yourself with unidentified & cursed items, hunger, permadeath, & constantly shifting dungeons in this mode.
$250,000 - New Game+ - Play through the game again with your character, battle harder enemies, and find an array of new items.
$275,000 - Gender Swap - Play as a female soldier on the same perilous journey.
$300,000 - Language Translations - Professional translations and localization into Spanish, French, German, & Italian.
$325,000 - Extra Area - A seventh area added to the main game with its own unique challenges, treasure, and enemies.
$350,000 - Community Choice Mode - Backers vote for their favorite from a selection of game modes by the developers.
The Game 
Chasm (pronounced kaz-um)  is a 2D Action-RPG Platformer currently in development for Windows, Mac, & Linux. Taking equal inspiration from hack ‘n slash dungeon crawlers (procedurally generated dungeons, loot drops, etc) and Metroidvania-style platformers, the game aims to immerse you in its 2D fantasy world full of exciting treasure, deadly enemies, and abundant secrets. 
We are attempting to create an authentic retro experience similar to the games you remember. Chasm was heavily influenced by games like Castlevania: Symphony of the Night, The Legend of Zelda, Metroid and Diablo. If these games are your style, then this is the game you have been waiting for!
In Chasm, players take up the role of a soldier passing through a remote mining town on their journey home from a long war. The town’s miners have recently disappeared after breaching a long-forgotten temple far below the town, and reawakened an ancient slumbering evil. Now trapped in the town by supernatural forces, you’re left with no option but to explore the mines below, battle enemies and bosses, and increase your abilities in hopes of finally escaping and returning home.
The mine entrance in Karthas.
  Current and Planned Features 
Explore Metroid-like dungeons procedurally assembled from hand-crafted rooms in six diverse areas.
Enjoy challenging retro gameplay and gorgeous authentic pixel art (320×180 native resolution) 
Discover new special abilities and powers to reach previously inaccessible areas
Play how you want by equipping weapons, spellbooks, shields, and more to both hands
Uncover random loot drops and rare items
Battle massive bosses & mini-bosses
Avoid devious traps and platforming hazards
Includes Normal and Hardcore (Scored with Permadeath) Modes
Leaderboards for Hardcore playthroughs featuring quickest time, least damage taken, and more
Windows, Mac, & Linux versions with Gamepad support
Exploring the mines.
Why Kickstarter? 
Since James quit his job last year to focus on Discord Games, he has been relying on income from sales of Take Arms to keep the company running. He knew Chasm was a much bigger game than he could afford to make, but thought that if he could do it right, people would see the potential of the idea.
We met our initial goal of a playable demonstration, but funds for development are now depleted. Simply put, this game can not be made without your support.  We've been waiting forever for a game like this, but game publishers today just aren't interested in projects like this one. With your support, we will be able to finish the game ourselves and give you a truly amazing experience. Your generous pledges will go towards: 
Living Costs: James and Tim still need to eat, pay bills, and afford life-giving coffee while they develop the game.
Paying Artists and Sound Designer: We will need money to pay our wonderful team for their hard work.
Polish and Improvement: Making sure Chasm is a quality, bug-free game with enough time dedicated to it.
Business & Legal Costs: To officially sell the game, we need to keep up with administrative costs and other expenses related to the business.
Promotion & Marketing: We will need to commission awesome final box art, promotional graphics, video trailers, etc.
Getting the drop on some unsuspecting kobolds.
Access to the Game
Your pledge of $15 or greater will get you a copy of the final game when it’s released. We do not know what will be our primary method of distribution, but regardless, we will give you a DRM-free copy for Windows, Mac and/or Linux. See below for estimated system requirements. We're aiming to be content complete early 2014 and then release the game by May 2014. This is subject to change, and the closed Beta will likely cause delays.
EARLY ACCESS
Pledging $30 or more ($25 for early birds!) will also give you access to our closed Beta. The exact date and details are still uncertain, but we will attempt to start it a couple months before the game is officially released to the public.The game will be highly playable at this phase (at least 90% content complete), but we will still be adding, removing and testing features. As a tester, you will have a direct effect on the game by playing and voicing your opinions and feedback on the private Developer forum. This also includes identifying any performance issues and bugs.
Checking the map for directions.
System Requirements 
The requirements are subject to change. Chasm is being developed with older hardware in mind, and shouldn't be too demanding. However, due to how XNA's graphics system works, you will need at least a Pixel Shader 2.0+ capable graphics card. If you have any question of compatibility, please download the demo and try it out for yourself!
OS: Windows (XP/Vista/7), MacOS X, or Linux
Processor: 2ghz+
Memory: 512 MB

Finding a hidden fountain.

The Team
 James Petruzzi - Producer - @DiscordGames
James is the founder of Discord Games, and serves as Producer, Game Designer and Programmer on Chasm. His two previous games 48 Chambers and Take Arms were released on Xbox 360 and PC, and have sold over 20,000 copies combined. He quit his corporate office job in 2012 to devote himself solely to the development of Chasm. 
 Tim Dodd - Programmer - @RoboDodd
Tim has worked on both released Discord Games titles, and served as Lead Programmer on Discord's 2D multiplayer shooter Take Arms. He has been programming for over 10 years as both hobbyist and professional. He will be writing tools for content production in Chasm, as well as advanced engine features and gameplay programming.
 Tony Redmer - Environment Art - @TonyRedmer
Tony has worked as a 2D environment artist on over five released titles in the last two years. While environment art is his specialty, he worked tirelessly to develop Chasm's distinctive visual style. He will be handling the art direction and environment pixel art in Chasm.
 Glauber Kotaki - Sprite Animations - @unseven
Glauber has been working as a 2D game artist since 2004, on more than 30 released games (indie and commercial). His specialties are pixel art and animation, but is also very keen of game design and development. He will be handling sprite animations on Chasm.
 Jimi Stevulak - Audiosmith - @Jimi0rigi
Jimi has been writing music, recording and doing audio production for the last 15 years. In addition to his two albums and EP, he also wrote the music for both Discord releases (48 Chambers and Take Arms). He will be handling the music and sound effects in Chasm, as well as assisting with story and script.

campaign.story:
Myth Box
Myth is a cooperative game for 2 to 5 players developed and published by MERCS Miniatures. A complete game in Myth is called a Story. Each Story is played over three Acts. Acts can be played sequentially, or can be split up over three different game sessions. Each Act lasts 2 hours.
Myth Heroes in Battle
Players' avatars within a Story are called Heroes. Myth Heroes are clothed in immense power, able to reave all but the mightiest foes. However, this power must be balanced lest the Darkness take too much notice. Players must weigh their actions against the Threat each will bring, with the consequences of awakening more evil and bringing doom on the party's endeavors. And be careful they must, as the Darkness is formidable and eager to snatch glory from the valiant.
Heroes are controlled through an intuitive Hero Deck (videos for each Hero can be found in the Game Play Videos section below). Each deck plays uniquely and allows players more freedom of action and the ability to truly impact the Story each and every Act. Yet, cooperation is the key to victory and bloody fortune. Players must communicate, interact, and assist each other or surely the Darkness will cover all.
Hero board
Hero cards
Item cards
Myth is a fully cooperative game. There is no player controlling the Darkness. The Darkness is governed by a set of rules unique to each Boss Deck. Yet, the Darkness is activated through Hero actions. If the Heroes get overzealous, then the Darkness pushes back by activating Lairs, spawning Captains, and punishing the Heroes with devious Events. If the Heroes take a more subtle approach, then the Darkness reacts by reducing the potential for treasure and rewards. Without the treasures and equipment to upgrade, the Heroes will find each Act more difficult and eventually fail. The dynamic nature of the Darkness really lends a more fluid feel to the Story. Players aren't being driven by properties out of their control, nor are they being shepherded by a person whose skill has a direct impact on the enjoyment of the game. 
Creature sculpts
Myth setup offers players the freedom to experiment and create the Story they want. Each Act is created by placing the double-sided World Tiles in any configuration desired, then each tile is populated through random card draws (or by choice). Enemy-types, quests, treasure, merchants, and events are all variables controlled by players. Each Story is unique and breathed to life by the players. 
Myth is a fun fantasy romp where players feel truly heroic. In the playing of the game, the players are creating their own mythos. These stories are the ones carried away from the table, becoming myths themselves. And these are the myths, with friends and family, that we carry with us; telling and retelling our endeavors at the mead benches, earning treasured smiles and laughter.

Who We Are 
Keith Lowe – Artist 
For the past eight years I've worked as a Graphic Designer for BradyGames, learning good design and what it means to develop a property.  During that time, I also co-founded MERCS. I've been at the helm of the visuals since the beginning. It started as an outlet to quench my thirst for drawing and painting. It has always been my passion to create amazing characters and worlds.
Myth has been an exciting project to tackle. I felt inspired from the earliest discussions about it. It is a simple but potent idea of warriors sitting around a campfire spinning grand tales. Stories of amazing creatures and quests that would become a reality for the player. It's a great idea that acted like a spark.
Visually I wanted Myth to be colorful, full of energy, and appealing to a broad age group. I wanted to create a look that has depth, but you can also feel good about playing it with your kids. I hope you enjoy the look as much as I do. It offers loads of inspiration for me as an artist, and with your help it can continue to grow.
Brian Shotton – Game Design 
The Myth project started a year and a half ago on a plane to PAX Prime.  Kenny and I, with nothing better to do on a four hour flight, began talking about games we wish existed or games we wish were different. We quickly landed on the fantasy genre, as old school D&D was very dear to our hearts. We wanted a game that would allow us to feel heroic, to feel like we were what we claimed to be.
Fast forward a couple months. I am fiddling with what would become the card system for the Myth Heroes when a thought sprang full-born from my brain, an Old-English thought actually - boasts made on the mead benches (or around a table at your local FLGS) must hold true. We must be true to our words and these fables we weave must be played out. Kenny and I started laying the foundation of the game that weekend. Many months later, here we are.
I have been in and around hobby gaming for most of my life. My first design, MERCS, has afforded me many an opportunity in the hobby game industry. Myth is a very fun game and it pleases me to put my name on this game.
Kenny Sims – Game Design
I've been a gamer my entire life - board games, video games, role-playing games, all of them. Gaming has given me so much pleasure over the years. I've always wanted to create games that others could enjoy. Working with Brian and Keith to create Myth has given me the opportunity to bring that dream to life.
In creating Myth, we wanted to make a cooperative game where no one had to be the bad guy. A game where a group of friends could come together and have an adventure, facing menacing foes and challenging odds in a shared story, where everyone has a part to play and each role is just as important as any other. I'm extremely pleased with the end result and can't wait to hear the stories of other adventurers as they experience Myth.
Special Thanks
To all of our family and friends who have supported us. campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Through MERCS we have produced miniatures, dice, books, cards, maps, and counters. 

From past experience, anytime we've dealt with sculptors, printing, and production in terms of timing things can arise. We have successfully delivered multiple products produced in China, as well as dice produced in the UK. We understand that when it comes to anything produced overseas, delays can happen, especially with shipping and customs delays. Luckily, we have multiple people on the ground in China that shepherd our stuff from place-to-place and keep us updated in terms of where things are.

We've done our best to minimize unknowns as much as a company can, and we are always happy to refund pledges if for some totally unforeseen reason the game can't be delivered at all. Since the game is 60% complete, we don't believe this is the least bit likely.

Any MERCS player will tell you that our rapport with our communities is one of our strengths. We put out a lot of updates and communicate things as they happen. We'll communicate all pieces and parts through the Kickstart update tab as well as a simple Myth webpage. 

Every model is in either an advanced stage of sculpt or in production. 70% of the art is done. In effect, we have nine months to print and produce Myth. We've given ourselves a large window and if we can, will deliver the game early.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
WHAT'S THIS ALL ABOUT??

  Many of you very generously supported my previous Kickstarter campaign which is delivering as I type and the reactions to the effort have been incredible. Now I am set to finish the transition from metal to plastic for the rest of the RBG line. This is still a VERY significant investment and not something that I can afford without your support. It is my intention to offer the entirety of the RBG line a material that I can price to bring RBG figures to every gamer's table in the hobby. It is further my goal to expand RBG to encompass more of the Traditional Old School Fantasy Spectrum. I want to produce, Characters, Monsters, and even Terrain! I can do this with your help. The HelsVakt kickstarter was a great step in the right direction and with your help and support we can make this Kickstarter into something huge! 

  We are beginning with the goblins by popular demand but I have a LOT of stuff to retool and I will be taking every comment and request under consideration as the campaign progresses. It is my plan to move on to the Dvergr or the Aenglish after the goblins are retooled, hopefully there will be enough time in this campaign to make that happen but that is all up to you!

 HOW THIS WORKS
Your pledge corresponds to a specific reward level. Thus far the rewards for this campaign are structured by dividing the different goal products into Solos, Lesser Ranks, and Special Ranks. Each goal product is described in it's funding pitch as either a Solo option, lesser rank option or Special rank option. When a funding goal is reached the goal product then becomes available for selection as a reward for your contribution. So for instance up to the $15,000.00 funding mark if you pledge to the Raiding Party level you can choose 2 " ranks " of spear men ( 12 models in each set ) and 3 sets of  archers, after the $15,000.00 mark you can choose either the spear men or the footmen or both to fulfill your lesser ranks selection.

    If you wish, you can add to your pledge to buy additional ranks or solos not covered by your pledge. The values for each are as follows;
    SOLO .............................$5.00
    LESSER RANKS...........$25.00
    SPECIAL RANKS.........$35.00
     THE STORY
  So here we find ourselves....Stalking the root twisted floor of the Dokk Wolds. Bent low beneath the wicked reaching bones of the gnarly oaks aged and weathered. The day long passed into night. The moon high but barely more than a ghost shrouded by heavy clouds bearing low the first snows of the winter. The chill wind whips about our cloaked forms bitter and spiteful. Our breath spirited a-fright, our steps furtive, our hands be-gripped the hilt of sword and axe and hammer. Hung from our weary shoulders our shields ragged and gouged bear the story of the melee that drove us from the road and harrowed us by day to this cursed knot. Our ears wide and listening, fooled at every crack of twig under foot or creak of barren branch. Fools! Our hunters will make no such warnings to us! It is our eyes narrowed and keenly watching and our wits clear and calm that will find the watchers in the shadows now awaiting our strength to sap and our will to break. They, our would be death, the creeping, fanged, feral bastards of the Wild God, Great Horned Bas. Scampering little devils so gleefully cruel,  what for the mad blood thirst of their degenerate Gods drives them so.

 It is no matter. We must steel ourselves to live another day. Limber your arms fellows, for death awaits us on point of rusty spear and barbed arrow, and looted sword and sax. Pray you fervently that those vicious hulks, sharp bones through their skins and drugged stupor in their eyes, do not walk amoungst them.........For if they do, then this day we are surely lost.......Odin's Breath be strong brothers....
 THE FIGURES
 DIRE WOLVES!!!
 Nigh the size of a man and beset the ravenous hunger of the great wolf god himself the Dire Wolves race through tangled wood and over open ground with equal ferocity slathering jaws agape to rip and rend the flesh of their prey, man and beast alike it matters not when the Howling God leads the way.. Summoned forth from the deepest primordial wilds they serve the will of Fenris only!
Add the Dire wolves to your pledge for an additional $15.00 per set of three. Or $25.00 per set of six. The Dire wolves are NOT considered a lesser or special ranks selection. These are a separate item all together. The Dire Wolves are modularly fitted for universally interchangeable heads and are supplied with 40mm round bases.
LESSER RANKS SELECTION
 RUNTY GOB SPEARMEN!!!!  FUNDED!!!!
Feral, vicious, and swarming the goblin hordes inhabit the deepest darkest of forests only venturing out in search of pillage and plunder. Small as they may be they are dangerous and devious! The most commonly encountered goblins are the runty gob spearmen and archers. Though small and lightly armed these goblins are no laughing matter for they are cunning and vicious and often employ wicked poisons and devious traps or ambush.

  Goblins are pictured on 20 mm bases

  SOLO OPTION
  RUNTY GOB ARCHERS!!!
 Upon reaching our goal of $5,000.00 the runty gobs will be made available as a selectable option. The Spearmen are selectable as lesser ranks option with each rank consisting of 2 sets of the 6 figures pictured above in each rank. The Archers are available together as a solo option with all three figures pictured above counting as 1 solo option.
STRETCH GOAL # 2 $12,500.00
    LESSER RANKS SELECTION 
   RUNTY GOB FOOTMEN!!!!! FUNDED!!!!
   All new and ready for battle the runty goblin footmen. These are the honoured warriors of goblin kind. Earning the spoils of victory by strength of arm, or skill in battle these goblins bear the arms of fallen dwarves, men and even elves. They are not as cowardly as most goblins and are usually smarter as well. A formidable force that NO goblin warband can be without!

  These figures are available as a themed set titled " Runty Gob Footmen " Each set includes 12 footmen figures and 3 weapon sprues. Each footman is modularly fitted for universally interchangeable hand weapon options.  The goblins here are pictured still WIP on 20 mm round bases. and are available as a lesser rank option upon funding.
STRETCH GOAL # 3 $15,000.00 ..............FUNDED!!!
DOG'SBANE!!! Cruel and devious Dog's bane has clawed, kicked, bitten, stabbed, poisoned, burned, smashed, drowned, bashed and speared his way to the top of the long howlers' spearmen. Under his snarling barks the Runty gob spearmen don't dare turn tail and run, unless Dog's Bane does first! ( pictured here on a 20 mm base )
BLACK TONGUE!!!
foot cheiftan of the Long Howler's Gnawed Leg clan. Unique amoungst his kind Black Tongue fights with more of what could pass for courage than most other goblins. He fights with skill and cunning and puts great effort to make an impression upon friend and foe alike for his cruelty and ruthlessness.
STRETCH GOAL # 4-5 $ 18,000.00 -$21,000.00 - $25,000.00
 SPECIAL RANKS SELECTION 
   GOBLIN BONEBACKS!!!
   Brutal, Fearless, and dumb as a sack of rocks these goblin Brutes are the biggest, meanest, and most dangerous goblin kind to rage out of the Black Woods. Battle mad and usually drugged stupid with rotted poisonous mushrooms the Bonebacks fling themselves into the thick of battle without the slightest regard for themselves and no other intent but bathing in the blood of anything that happens to get too close be they friend or foe. It is their implaccability that makes them so incredibly dangerous. They do not turn and flee and they do not flinch at even horrible pain. ( pictured here on 25 mm bases. )

The goblin bonebacks are modularly fitted for universally interchangeable weapons. The weapon options to be included in each set will be 2 cleavers, 2 swords, 2 clubs, 2 small axes, 2 large axes, 2 maces, and 2 hammers( all cast in metal. The Bonebacks are available as a special rank set option upon funding . The first set of 4 will unlock at $18,000.00 and the second set of 4 will unlock at $21,000.00. Then the final set of 4 will unlock at $25,000.00. If the final total of the KS campaign does not go above $18,000.00 then you will receive 3 sets of the first 4 models to complete the ranks selection for the Bonebacks. If the final amoutn does nto go over $21,000.00 you will receive two sets of the first set of four and 1 set of the second set of four. But if the final amount DOES go above the $25,000.00 mark then you will receive 12 unique boneback figures to complete the bonebacks rank.

      Stretch goal # 6 $35,000.00
    SPECIAL RANKS SELECTION 
    RUNTY GOBS WOLFRIDERS!!!
    The most honoured amoungst the Long Howlers tribe are the Wolf Riders. Famed through out all the goblin tribes these goblins are part warrior and part shaman sharing a spiritual bond with the beasts on whose backs they ride terrifying into battle. Combining the strength , agility, and speed of the wolves with the devious combat prowess of the goblin and some slight shaman magic as well the goblin wolfriders are a force to feared by any whose path they cross. Whether armed with bow, blade, or spear the Wolf riders make any goblin force an army of merit. These figures are available as a special rank set titled " Wolf Riders A. " each set includes 4 wolves and 4 hand weapon riders options and 1 sprue of weapons. The riders are fitted for universally interchangeable hand weapons.
STRETCH GOAL  # 7 $45,000.00
 SPECIAL RANKS SELECTION 
   THE TROLL BROTHERS!!!
Nothing strikes fear into the hearts of the Northlanders and goblins a-like as do the long shadow of the great Troll Kind. Often keeping to the deepest caves and forest valleys the Troll Kind only venture into the lands of the Dvergr or Njorn or Aenglish for plunder or revenge, but sometimes they ally with their lesser cousins the goblin kind at behest or fear of great magick. Just such is the story of the Troll Brothers. Strong enough to throw huge stones over castle ramparts Rocklobber is a name feared far and wide, while Hogsquasher's legendary gleeful cruelty and ferocity has stopped many a great hero in their tracks on hearing the name of this great beast. Add the Troll Brothers to your existing pledge as 1 special rank set. ( Pictured here on 40 mm bases )
STRETCH GOAL # 8 $50,000.00
    INDIVIDUAL HERO SELECTION
   CROWBITER!!! 
   Older than any living goblin can remember, more crazed than any shaman to boil the red mushrooms before him, and more wicked than even the Old Horned One himself, it is Crowbiter who leads the Long Howlers more so than that fat, stupid, slathering oaf Horsebane, but a cunning leader is he who pretends to serve another. By Crowbiter's magicks have many a battle turned in favour of the fanged kin, and it was by Crowbiter's powers and persuasion that the great Troll Brothers first sat  at the Stone Circle to feast with the Long Howlers on the Dwarves of Garmingen's Fort. By his magicks do the dire wolves howl and heel, and by his will do the Long Howlers kill and steal.

  Crowbiter will be available as a singular solo option upon funding.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I have been operating Red Box Games for 5 years now. In that time I have developed a reputation for prompt, personal service and reliability. I work very very hard to insure that every customer is HAPPY with their order and the service provided to see it to them. I know what it takes to make a miniature work for production and shipment and to also work for the general use of gaming and painting. Almost every one of the miniatures proposed for production in this Kickstarter are already ready for production. At this point all that is left is for them to be remolded and cast in a new material. The only challenge involved here is in the productive capacity of the mold maker / caster and any difficulty encountered there will be resolved as it arises by hiring on new help to create the manpower necessary to deliver the product as advertised and on time. Troll's forge is a very well established and reliable service and is dedicated to seeing this effort through to it's greatest success.

Beyond that only the fulfillment effort on my end would be any other foreseeable challenge, which will be fixed with the hiring of a full time employee if this campaign funds as I hope it will.

 I am now in the process of delivering on my recently successful Kickstarter project. The delivery is behind schedule ( originally intended for October of 2012 ) but is now in the final stages of fulfillment. We encountered set backs of varying nature through out the production process but have since made the necessary corrections and have learned how to avoid them on future works. Primarily I was just too optimistic in my expectation for the length of time needed to deliver on the project. Ed and I have conferred extensively on this matter and we have decided on a much more realistic delivery date for this next Kickstarter campaign.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Hey Y'all,
   Well after a great deal of very careful consideration I will be cancelling this KS campaign today. The reason being that we will not make the funding neccessary for the bonebacks and wolf riders and based on most of the private messages I have received and the forum posts and comments I have read those two items are the most desired rewards. I choose rather to be sure that you guys have the items that you actually want than to force you to pay for items that you do not. Believe me it is NOT easy doing this. 

   My plan from here is to finish two of the wolf riders and concept or finish a wolf rider hero. I will then relaunch the campaign with the first goal covering 6 of the footmen, 6 of the bonebacks, and 2 wolf riders. After that the stretch goals will be spaced apart by $5,000.00 to insure that we regularly achieve to finish filling out the goblin horde. I will also be structuring the rewards in such a way that no one is pledging toward options that do not yet exist so as to avoid the problems we have had here.

  Do not worry about the delivery time slipping. I have spoken with Ed and have confirmation that we can keep that date. He understands my reasoning and has confidence in the potential. Further the Relaunch will only be about 1 or 2 weeks away from now. In that time I am going to work very hard to get all the bells and whistles in place for the next campaign to be sure that it is as clear as possible.

Well, here I am again..... We have now slipped below the $15,000.00 mark and I think we will probabyl begin to slip even further still rather than bouncing upward. So I am thinking that in the best interests of you guys it might be best to kill this campaign and relaunch with a different sequence of figures, prioritizing the Footmen, Wolf Riders, and BoneBacks in that order as that seems to be the most wanted sets out of this campaign.

UPDATE
Funding successful! Thanks to everyone who made this a possibility. There are still a few days left to go. Any additional money raised will go recouping the payment for the first half of the pencils and for the coloring.
I sent off the first few pages to a handful of publishers late last week, so fingers crossed.
Black Lotus Empire is a 12 issue, full-color comic book series that explores what life might be like in China almost 100 years from now.  In BLE, China is now the sole economic and military superpower in the world, and the government frequently engages in intimidation, violence, and control of information to keep the people in line. But cracks are forming, and the leaders know that unrest may threaten their rule, so a sinister general has been giving the authority to create a fighting force to combat China’s only true enemy: her own people.
The comic was created and written by me and features stunning artwork by Carlos Gomez (pencils) and Neeraj Menon (colors).
Sparrow: the protagonist. Pencils: Carlos Gomez, Colors: Neeraj Menon
Ok, but what is the story?
It is the dawn of the 22nd century. For a century, China’s leaders have bought their peoples’ submission with continued growth and prosperity, but as the economy grinds to a halt, protests have broken out in the megacities. Life for urban dwellers is still far better than for those in the impoverished rural areas, which have borne the scars of China’s ongoing industrial revolution. Pollution has contaminated the water, the soil, and even the food the people rely on. Severe birth defects occur in record numbers, though many go unreported. Most families cannot afford to take care of a crippled child. They need a strong, sturdy son to help them earn a living. Because of the one-child policy, many babies born with deformities are simply abandoned by their parents. The military, under the ambitious General Ying, has begun the practice of taking these unwanted children and experimenting on them to create a force of Supersoldiers called the Chāo Shìbīng. Their mission: to combat the growing number of internal threats to the stability of China. The protagonist of BLE is one of these unwanted children. Sparrow was abandoned by her parents because she was born with wings. Fortunately, she was adopted by a kindly army officer who sought to protect her from Ying’s program. In time, she was discovered and taken away; her father imprisoned. After years of training, General Ying has activated her to assassinate a high ranking dissident leader who has suddenly surfaced.

The story begins with Sparrow fighting against the Dissidents, but a discovery leads her to change sides. Now she must turn a rag tag group of dissidents into a fighting force that can take on the military, while simultaneously overcoming her crippling temper, and coping with her feelings for a fellow freedom fighter.

What is the money for?
Good art ain't cheap! The amount I am asking for covers half the cost of the pencils for Black Lotus Empire #1, plus all Kickstarter and Amazon fees, and costs for printing and shipping the pledge rewards. I am really happy to be working with Carlos Gomez, a talented young artist from Spain. I paid the first half out of pocket, and I will be paying for the coloring out of pocket as well.
Type 9 “Black Lotus” Light Combat Uniform. Pencils: Carlos Gomez, Colors: Neeraj Menon
What's the ultimate goal?
I plan to shop issue one around to comic publishers to see if anyone will pick up the 12 issue run. If not, I will self publish and hope to make enough money off of each issue to fund the next one.I don't really plan on making a penny off of the comic, and may even lose some money, but I am having fun writing it and I would love to see it come to life. If this works out, I have a couple of other stories I want to start work on.
Type 9 “Black Lotus” Heavy Combat Uniform. Image by Jeff Miller
What if the funding goal isn't met?
If I can't meet my funding goal, then I will have to dip further into my savings to pay for the book.The truth is, I don't have a huge Facebook following, or millions of followers on Twitter. This is the second time I am running the Kickstarter project, this time with a lower goal and better rewards. I'm just an average guy trying to live out a piece of his childhood dream, and I truly appreciate anyone who gives a dime to help me make that happen.Thanks for taking the time to view.

Chinese helicopter concept. Image by Jeff Miller
International Backers
For rewards of $15 and up, please add $5 dollars.

To keep up with the latest after-project updates visit Bombshellminis.com for more news.
We will continue to post regular updates on the Kickstarter project as well as comments. If you are interested in continued support for the Bombshell Babes project beyond the Kickstarter funding period, we will be posting more info on a dedicated page at the regular site.
Babes Sculpts in Progress
For more updates on the sculpts in progresss visit the Sculpts Page.
These are progress pictures of the Babes sculpts I'm currently working on. They will go through a series of iterations until they are the best sculpts they can be. As my own art director, there is a lot of leeway to make them as close to the concept art as I feel is possible or to vary from it as necessary, as long as the coolness factor is ramped up.
As requested - here is a preliminary shot of Maelee next to a couple of popular figures sculpted by Jeff Grace for Dark Sword and Werner Klocke for Reaper so you can gauge the size of the intended models. Keep in mind, some of our figures may actually be a little larger or smaller depending on the character portrayed.
The Idea
For several years now I have been wanting to launch a new boutique line of miniatures featuring strong female characters. Although I'm using terms like "Bombshell" and "Babes" to describe the line, these characters are much more than either of those outdated terms. The concept needed something retro and nostalgic that evoked images of famous paintings like J. Howard Miller's "We Can Do It" and Rockwell's "Rosie the Riveter".
With this new concept, I want to create a strong recognizable brand that stands for excellence in figurative sculpting. My recent work (shown above) for some of the top companies in the gaming industry has brought me into contact with a fantastic group of creative professionals eager to collaborate on this project. From concept art and character design to sculpting and painting the finished models, my goal is to create beautiful figurative sculpture in miniature. And now we have an exceptional team of skilled and talented collaborators who share that goal.

The funding goal goes directly to pay the artists and designers to make the characters tangible. It also will go to the sculptors who will be providing the characters and pieces for molding as well as all of the other production costs like 3D printing, casting, packaging and various other promotional expenses.

We also have several characters officially licensed from artist Matt Dixon that will be added to our Babes line.  Our figures will be engineered to make them easy to add to alternate bases for a variety of gaming or painting needs. Care will also be taken to size the figures so they will be compatible with other models from the most popular manufacturers within the 30mm range. The Babes will be cast in metal with a variety of accessory sprues available along with resin creatures and vehicles.

The base insert will be scaled to fit inside of the depression on a 30mm premium round-lipped base common to many tabletop games. I have created numerous base inserts just like these for Wyrd Miniatures and we are happy to be able to include them with each of our Babe models.

campaign.story:
The Game
Goalsystem Delves provides rules and adventures for playing character-driven skirmish games in fantasy worlds of mysteries, magic, and monsters. These rules harken back to the days of classic dungeon crawls and the world’s most popular fantasy RPG.  Players take the roles of a group of hardened adventurers seeking treasure, glory, and the defeat of the festering evils that remain hidden in the darkest corners of forgotten dungeons.
Dungeon Skirmish?
Goalsystem Delves seamlessly blends RPG and tabletop miniature elements into a fast paced tabletop experience that provides the depth of an RPG with the fast paced action of a tactical miniatures game. Delves plays fast, allowing players to run a multi-encounter Adventure in a single session and epic campaigns over multiple sessions.
Using the proven and popular Goalsystem, Delves delivers character driven action that’s deep enough for RPG gamers and fast enough for miniature gamers. 
Delves works with any 28mm or 15mm miniatures in your collection. 
Oni Mage miniature concept art
Fantasy Toolkit
Delves features 6 character classes and 12 sub-classes that cover all of the major tropes of the dungeon fantasy genre. In addition to a dozen player character races, we also include more than 30 monsters, 30 spells, and lots of weapons and equipment that you can use to bring your adventures to life. But Delves is your game, and we provide the tools you need to run dungeon skirmishes your way. To this end the game also includes rules for creating your own races, classes, and creatures, making Delves the ultimate fantasy toolkit!
Sample Page
What We Will Produce
We have a lot of great rewards that you can pledge for individually or as part of one of our great packages.
The Book: A 6” x 9”, 248pp, black and white, hardcover book. Made in the USA with a Smythe-sewn binding. This book will last a lifetime of gaming sessions.
Dice: A set of 10 custom Goalsystem dice. these are 19mm dice produced by Chessex with the Goalsystem logo replacing the six.  
T-Shirt: An official Goalsystem Logo T-Shirt (pictured below)
Figures: A set of five special edition miniatures made available especially for this project.
Terrain: A set of expertly painted dungeon terrain produced by our partner Tinker’s Lair. Made from recycled tires, this terrain is the next evolution in dungeon terrain.(pictured below)
T-Shirt (not finalized)
Who's Involved
We have a lot of really talented  people from throughout the tabletop game and comics industry involved in the productions of Delves.
Scott Pyle: Game Designer - Creator of Goalsystem, Scott has a number of RPG and tabletop titles under his belt; highlights include SuperSystem and Chaos in Carpathia. Scott also contributed to the Savage Worlds superhero sourcebook, Necessary Evil.
Chris Moeller: Artist and Illustrator - Chris is the creator of the Iron Empires sci-fi universe. He has done extensive freelance work in the comic and gaming industries, including projects for DC comics (League of One) and Wizards of the Coast (D&D, Magic the Gathering).   
Enrico Nardini: Marketing/Social Media/Video Production - Rico's a regular on the US convention scene, and in addition to his work in marketing, social media, and video production, has contributed both fiction and design assistance to the Delves project. He is also the Editor of the Play Unplugged online gaming magazine.
Joe Dragovich: Designer/Illustrator - A Kickstarter veteran, Joe is coming off of of his latest Goalsystem project, The Department which was successfully funded and released earlier this year.
Thomas Scioli: Illustrator -   Tom is the fan-favorite comic book artist for Image Comics' Godland. Tom has also worked for Marvel Comics on the World's Greatest Comic Magazine Fantastic Four maxi-series. His own work includes the critically acclaimed Myth 8-Opus. Check out more of his amazing stuff at his blog.
Carrie Posing: Illustrator - Carrie is a talented, up and coming artist capable of working in multiple mediums. She also provided some excellent play-test work during rules development! Check out her work at her own web site. 
Joshua Dahle: Illustrator - Just finishing with his BFA, Josh Dahle can't wait to make his mark on the adventure gaming industry! He may be new to the gaming biz, but he won't remain unknown for long!  Check out his powerful work at his blog. 
Chelsea van Tol: Illustrator - Chelsea's a favorite artist and designer among the paper miniature community, and she's lent her wonderfully subtle lines to character designs on the Delves project. Check out more of her cool stuff at Offbeat Orc.com. 
Rachel Masiliamani: Illustrator - Rachel's a graphic novelist whose own RPM Comics have drawn critical acclaim. While she does not enjoy drawing fight scenes, she does love magic bookshelves!
Jan Annarella: Illustrator - Jan's a longtime contributor to Goalsystem games, with his art debuting in the first edition of SuperSystem in 2002. Jan's clean style and exacting attention to detail make his work ideal for this project.
Schuyler Hernstrom: Writer/Illustrator - Sky's nifty little line drawings help to give Delves a gritty, pulpy feel that fits so nicely with the core of the dungeon fantasy genre. His prose work possesses a painterly quality that both informs the world and entertains the reader.
Donald Gentry: Terrain Designer - One of the men behind the War Torn Worlds line of pre-painted terrain, Don and his partner have pioneered the process of using recycled tire rubber to make hyper-durable gaming terrain. Through his new venture Tinker's Lair, Don has specially produced our Cavern of Blood dungeon terrain set especially for this Kickstarter. 
Tom Mason: Sculptor - Tom runs Effigy Miniatures, and he's the designer of the Oni-Mage, one of the five miniatures available for this project.We're super-excited to have Tom and Effigy on board for this project!
Andy Dormer: AKA Soapy, this brilliant British sculptor provides awesome figures for Crossover Miniatures. He's lent his amazing talents to the Delves project for our amazing Half-Orc Monk figure reward. Stay lucky, Soapy!
Part of the Caverns of Blood dungeon set in action!
The complete Caverns of Blood set laid out... that's a lot of dungeon!
The Money Side of Things
We're raising money for our creative and printing costs for the books. We have decided to use domestic production (in the United States) for this project. The book we are producing will be collector quality with the best available paper and binding. We'll also be stuffing the book full of excellent illustrations to inspire you to greater dungeon glory.
Stretch Goals
$13,000 - If we reach $13,000, we will produce an additional SE miniature to commemorate our spared kobold captive. That's right, Squeekik, The Kobold Retainer (the crying kobold from our advertisement "Back Goalsystem Delves Or We'll Slay This Kobold!") will be immortalized in miniature. This figure will be included automatically in any backer reward package of $100 or more and will be made available to our other backers as an $8 add-on.
$15,000 - If we reach $15,000, we will produce a complete PDF adventure, GD-4 Nightmare at Nordtown. This low-level adventure includes setup grid maps and unique adversary write-ups and will be a bonus reward to those who pledge $15 or more. 
$25,000 - If we reach $25,000 we will produce Goalsystem Delves: Myths, Magic, and Monsters, a softcover, black and white rules supplement that contains even more monsters, spells, and weapons. Released in both PDF and print versions, and the PDF version will automatically go to anyone who pledges $15 or more to the project, and print versions will go to anyone pledging $100 or more.
$35,000 - If we reach $35,000 we will produce a complete PDF adventure GD-5 Dunes of Death. Dunes of Death will be a more dangerous higher level adventure and will feature a new monster: the Cactus Golem. We will also produce two new SE miniatures, a Dust Devil and the Cactus Golem! The PDF adventure will go to all backers who pledge $15 or more and the two new SE miniatures will go to backers of $100 or more.

There are some “major” goings on down at Four-Color Studios. A new edition of SuperSystem is prepared to leap a tall building and land on your gaming table. I will work at getting these all into the post by Monday morning, but we shall see. We lose a day of shipping action this week due to the US Thanksgiving holiday
I still feel like I am ahead of the game, though. Anyway, I would ask that folks be patient and let the normally pretty reliable USPS do its work over the the next couple of weeks. Getting this stuff ahead of the holiday rush is a big boost, but it's still a high volume time of the year for all postal systems. If you should get your order and something is awry, please contact me and I will make it right. This end of the process has largely been a one-man show, so I am the first to admit that errors can occur. If this is the case, I will make things right.

Greetings, Delvers!
I believe this is known in some circles as proof of life!

Greetings, Delvers!  Upon receiving the PDF of the rules, a number of you kindly wrote us reporting some gaffes in the layout.  Chief among the mistakes were some copy-paste errors in the sample characters.  While the book is currently at the printers, I am happy to report that we were able to fix the sample character errors before actually going to press. JUNE 7th UPDATE: We're in the final stretch! Bonus gift: Blade Raiders wallpaper
Click this link for all the various wallpaper sizes and download links:
http://www.kickstarter.com/projects/165903443/blade-raiders-fantasy-roleplaying-game/posts/242039
MAY 31st UPDATE: 1st look at the Limited Edition hardcover
MAY 26th UPDATE: Initial goal reached! A Gift & Stretch Goal
A big thanks to all of you who've pledged! We've reached our initial goal -- and with over two weeks left to go! :) Thank you so much for being part of this project and for helping to make my RPG game a reality. I have two exciting announcements:
1) As a "thank you" gift, I'm immediately including a new reward for everyone who's pledged $10 or more -- Creature Cards!
2) And we now have a Stretch Goal of $9,000. If we hit this new amount, everyone who's pledged $25 or more will receive an "Adventure Folder."
Please click on the "Updates" tab above and check out my latest update (#3) for more information on the Creature Cards, Stretch Goal and Adventure Folders. And thanks again for all of your support!
MAY 21st UPDATE: 1st look at the character sheet, and exciting new Pledge Rewards!
As I write this, we're about 60% funded, which is amazing. Thank you so much to everyone who's pledged! :) As a little "thank you" for your support, I thought I'd offer a first look at the character sheet. Keep in mind, this is the working version. As I flesh things out and do some game testing, details and design elements are sure to change. But at least this gives you a pretty solid idea as to what you can expect. Click here for a bigger version: http://grantgould.com/art/brcs.jpg  Also, I added new Pledge Rewards: ORIGINAL ARTWORK from the book at the $200 level (limited to 30) and a PDF at $15. So please check those out. Thanks!
What is Blade Raiders?
Blade Raiders is an epic fantasy tabletop roleplaying game. Swords and sorcery, high adventure, creatures and quests -- All of the elements you crave, but presented with a unique spin you've never experienced before. The game will be written, assembled, and fully illustrated by me (you can check out my full bio on the right side of this page), and I'm confident people will enjoy the end result. I've been playing and running tabletop RPGs for over 25 years, so I know what makes a fun game and a great social experience. I look forward to sharing my vision with you and your gaming group. :)
Can you tell me more about the actual book itself?
This first book is the core rulebook. It contains everything you need to play the game, aside from dice -- World overview, character creation, combat rules, monster stats, and everything else needed to begin your adventure. The book will have an 8.5"x11"/magazine-size format (like many RPGs: Dungeons & Dragons, Palladium, Pathfinder, etc.), softcover, perfect-bound, featuring black-and-white interior pages and full-color covers. **A limited-edition hardcover version is available as well. See the rewards section for more info.**
When will the book be done?
If I reach my goal, I plan on having the book completely done by September and back from the printers by late October. If I don't reach my goal, then the project will be shelved. I just can't afford to spend the time needed on this unless I have some help. So, please, if you want this game to happen, make a pledge and tell your friends.
So what do I get if I pledge?
Rewards! :) Along the right-hand side of this page, you'll see the list of rewards based on the various amounts that you can pledge.
What does my money pay for?
Your money (assuming I reach my Kickstarter goal -- if the goal's not met, then you don't pay a penny) will make it possible for me to pay bills while I work on Blade Raiders. Being able to set aside a large chunk of time to illustrate the book and put it together is a huge part of making it happen. Additionally, your money will help pay for printing, rewards, and shipping costs.
Will there be more Blade Raiders books coming after this?
I certainly hope so! If the goal is reached, you can be sure that the first Blade Raiders sourcebook will be coming in early 2013.
If you have any other questions, be sure to check the FAQs below -- and if you don't find an answer there, feel free to message me. Thanks!
- Grant

campaign.story:
Once Mobile Frame Zero is in production you'll be able to find it and an entire garage of community-supported sites and tools at MobileFrameZero.com!
Giant robots! LEGO®! Strategy and tactics!
Mobile Frame Zero: Rapid Attack is the tenth anniversary edition of Vincent Baker's Mechaton. Build yourself a company of robots called mobile frames out of LEGO, give yourself some objectives to defend, lay out a table with a few friends, and fight! We're making sure you've got all the parts we've got so you can have the most fun you can with the game. You'll get play instructions, building instructions, even instructions for how to make your own setting. 
Because, just like a LEGO set, building what's on the front of the box is fun, but building your own thing is where it really catches fire. So that's what we want you to do! Build robots, play with our setting, sure! If you're into VOTOMS, Dougram, Macross, or Gasaraki, then we want to play with you! We've put a lot of love and care into the designs and the setting and we're excited to see what people do with them. But then check out the advice on building a setting and house rules, too, and go to town!
About the rules
Mobile Frame Zero: Rapid Attack is designed to be playable with two to five players, each fielding a company of mobile frames of different strengths. The game keeps tension high by making sure that no player ever quite has enough frames, equipment, or time to be a sure thing. In fact, the player in the strongest points position to win is the player with the weakest company; if you expect to fight from a difficult position, be ready to run away and come back in another round!
Play starts with the doomsday clock set to 11. Every turn, it ticks down by one automatically. At 0 the game ends. But adding to that is the possibility that each player can mark it down faster. If you're winning, you'll mark it down every round. If you think you'll be winning this round, you'll mark it down. Players never really know how soon the game will end until the very end.
Rules are tightly tied to the frames themselves. Every frame has its own two white dice, then has added to it up to four subsystems. Those systems help the frame move, attack at one of three ranges, defend themselves, and observe & communicate. When a frame takes damage, it takes damage by losing those systems. 
Play takes between 2.5 and 4 hours, depending on the age and number of players. Eager 10-year-olds seem to grasp the game well, but it offers a constantly flowing sea of tactical options to more experienced players.
About the Setting
It's the year 0245 of the Solar Calendar. The Earth-centered Solar Union has overstretched, abandoning the interstellar colonies and colonists that can no longer produce enough for its vast and struggling population.
When the Solar Union's colonial efforts reached the homeworld of the Ijad, they found their first opposition. Religiously opposed to empire, they quickly adopted the SU's technologies of interstellar travel and the muscle cylinders that made their mighty mobile frames possible. The Solar Union now finds its own technologies turned against it as the Ijad fight in their quadrupedal Scrambler frames to force back the tide of the Solar Union.
Inspired by the Ijad religion and rising against the Solar Union are the newly-formed Free Colonies. Fighting with labor frames and homebuilt mobile frames built from scavenged muscle cylinders, they take inspiration from the Ijad's liberation theology in the hopes of achieving Badhal — self-determination.
Within these factions are many more. You'll define your Ijad religious factions, your companies of United Mars Foreign Legionnaires and Terran Trade Marines, you Free Colonial popular movements. They might not agree with their purported allies, and they might find themselves friends with those who would be their enemies.
Mobile Frames
The United Mars Foreign Legion's ST-07 "Chubs", backed by their ACT-022A "Chub Tub". The Free Colonies' Hi-Leg — a low-cost homebuilt mobile frame and the converted labor frame, the Commissar. The Ijad's "Scrambler" and "Stalker" (names given the frames by the Terran Trade Marines who first encountered them) are often supported by Swerves, tiny flying craft designed to pierce and cut between the plates of enemy frames.
A sample of decals — a change in printers has allowed us to print a greater variety than you can see here.
Kickbacks
Soren and Joshua are working hard to bring some unique, limited edition stuff that we can't possibly mass-produce to you guys.
Decals are the first. Designed by Joshua A.C. Newman specifically for the Kickstarter, you'll receive sheets of transparent decals to distinguish your companies. They'll include symbols for all three factions including industrial markings, rank insignia, religious slogans, and kill markers.
The Mobile Frame Garage is a kit thoughtfully designed by Soren to give you a pile of parts appropriate for building mobile frames. Designed for players who don't have a big bin of LEGO at home, tiny hinges and other parts give you all you need for a company of five mobile frames. Presented in neutral colors, you can liven up your particular company by adding in parts from any LEGO set.
Soren's Special Edition kits are designed and hand-assembled by Soren to give you real punch right out of the box. There are only two of each faction, so choose wisely.
A custom-designed company by Joshua will set you up right. You'll chat with Joshua, who will help you figure out what faction you like the most, how you want to play tactically, and custom design and assemble your company.
A custom-designed company by Soren will make your company the most coveted in all of LEGO mecha. You'll consult with Soren and Joshua, working out what faction you want and how you want it to work tactically, and then Soren will build it up for you.

Who are we?
Vincent Baker (@lumpleygames on Twitter) is the designer and publisher of Dogs in the Vineyard, Apocalypse World, The Abductinators, and a bunch of other games. His website is lumpley.com.
Joshua A.C. Newman (@JoshuaACNewman on Twitter)is the designer and publisher of Shock:Social Science Fiction, Shock:Human Contact (a Kickstarter project also), and Under the Bed. His website is glyphpress.com.
Sebastian is our apprentice. He's Vincent's son and Joshua's godson. He's got a game coming out soon called Blasters for Hire about space bounty hunters.
Soren Roberts (@harmfulmechanic on Twitter) is an extraordinary artist and designer in the LEGO medium. He's been wowing the LEGO community with his mecha for years. You can see his work in his substantial Flickr stream.
One thing we're not is employees of LEGO. We're a bunch of guys who love it, but we're not them, at all. In fact, I can even tell you that there are other great building toys that you could use with the MFZ rules like Gundam models, Mega Blocks, or even little squads of metal miniatures where each unit, instead of a system, represents a die. 
Want to see something neat?
You should check out the Mobile Frame Zero: Rapid Attack Flickr pool. There are hundreds of robots from within and without the Solar Calendar from all different skill levels.
You'll also see a lot of neat stuff over at Zeekhotep's blog, No B.S., Just ABS. One thing you'll see is an interview with Joshua, talking about MFZ and where it came from! You'll also be able to participate in an ongoing discussion of tactics and building.
Cel•Style
Mobile Frame Zero is being published with the cool kids over at Cel•Style! Check out their incredible catalogue!

Update #6: We just made our next major milestone, thanks to you all, which means more content plus a Mac and Linux version. And the number continues to grow, and that means a better product for all as we can hire more writers and scripters to add even more depth of consequence to the world, add more music and sound to set the atmosphere, and make the world larger to explore. Let's keep the number increasing and really knock it out of the ballpark. I have been having a blast reading the messages of excitement from the RPG players who feel neglected over the years.
We wanted to have a little fun and make another comical video so I hope you enjoy it. The next video I put up will also be more informative as I will answer some of the more common questions from the forums. We are still deciding on the tech, and we don't know what the final budget is, so it can be difficult to have answers for everything right now.
So see our thoughts on Multi-player as well as a list of links to some of the great press we have been getting, go to our updates page by clicking "Updates " at the top of this page.
Brian Fargo appears on Hard Drive.
"I’m personally a big fan of the Wasteland series from having played the original game in the late 80s; I’ve also always admired Brian Fargo’s courage to experiment with new designs and game engines from my time working with him in the early days of BioWare when we worked with Interplay, and as a result I’m really looking forward to seeing the next game in the Wasteland series!" - Ray Muzyka - CEO Bioware
"Hats off to Fargo and inXile, I'm definitely putting my money down when they start up their Kickstarter fund, and I'll donate just as much as I did to Double Fine.  Give me Wasteland 2 already." - Chris Avellone - RPG designer extraordinaire
"Brian was one of the pioneers for the computer RPG with games like Bard's Tale and Wasteland.  I would be very excited to see what Brian could achieve with a sequel to such a classic like the first Wasteland."         - Rob Pardo - ExecutiveVice President of Game Design, Blizzard Entertainment
"WASTELAND is the game that made me a gamer.  It's still my favourite game of all time, simply because of how influential and mind-blowing it was at the time." - Rock Paper Shotgun reader Zerosociety
"Shut up and take my money!" - Eurogamer reader Arcam (amongst many others)
Wasteland 2 is the direct sequel to the first ever post-apocalyptic computer RPG. The original Wasteland was the inspiration for the FALLOUT series of games, and the first RPG to allow players to split parties for tactical considerations, to face players with moral choices, and to make them deal with the consequences of their actions. It was the first to provide far more than the one-key-for-one-lock style of puzzle solving. It was groundbreaking, which is why IGN named it one of the top 25 PC games of all time, Computer Gaming World named it the Adventure Game of the year in 1988, and it was short-listed for inclusion in the Smithsonian Institution’s current “Art of the Computer Game” exhibition.
Wasteland was set in a dangerous, post-apocalyptic world in the American Southwest. Over the course of adventures rangers would receive promotions, acquire new skills and equipment, then face new challenges with outcomes that changed depending on the strategy used to defeat them. The game featured a strong storyline which required painful decisions by players; and a storyline that allowed for maximum re-playability. Wasteland 2, with your participation and insights, will recapture all that and provide more.  It'll finally be the game worthy to be a Wasteland sequel, as challenging and rewarding as the original, with all added capacity and dazzle of games today.
For Wasteland 2, we’re getting the band back together again!. Brian Fargo who Executive Produced both Wasteland and Fallout will be heading the team. Alan Pavlish and Mike Stackpole—the original game’s primary designers—are coming back to put the project together, and we’re rounding up as many of the other designers, like Ken St. Andre, as we can. On top of that, we’ll have music by Mark Morgan of Fallout 1 and 2 fame. The storyline for Wasteland 2 was written by Jason Anderson who was the co-creator of Fallout. We have also enlisted the help of the amazing concept artist, Andree Wallin to help craft the Wasteland 2 world.
A sample of Andree's other work can be seen below.
Brian Fargo founded Interplay Productions (By Gamers, For Gamers) in 1983 where he went on to produce and finance some of the biggest RPG's made like Bard's Tale, Fallout 1 and 2, Stonekeep, Dragon Wars, Baldur's Gate, Icewind Dale, and more. Creating a new Wasteland will be a point of pride in the long history of games.
Not a month goes by when an email doesn’t come in asking if we’ve ever considered doing a sequel. Emails from gamers who remember Wasteland fondly and want, just as badly as we do, to return to that gritty world where burning through clips might be the only thing that keeps you alive; and where running out of ammo will certainly get you killed. The fact that you, the folks who know and love and play games, keep asking for Wasteland 2 told us that there is a demand for it.

So, we’re coming to you for support.

Financial.

And creative.

After all, since you’re the driving force behind this game, we want to make sure that we’ll be delivering the game you want. Wasteland is ready for a sequel, and with your help, it’s going to happen. As for why you should want to participate, we’ll let Kotaku point out why making Wasteland 2 happen is very important:  FanFundWasteland!
With your collective vision, the game that was the godfather to the popular Fallout series will become a reality.  Not only will you fund the development, but you’ll have a voice in how the game goes together. We will have forums up for design discussion and soliciting your ideas for what will make Wasteland 2 rock.
This is your chance to influence the kind of game you want to see. With fan funding, you drive the direction of game design and development. If it is important to you, it is important to us. 
This is probably the last chance for a Wasteland sequel.  We have tried to pitch this game multiple times to game publishers, but they’ve balked. They don’t think there’s any interest in a solid, old school type of game.  This is our shot at proving them wrong. And more importantly this could help bring back an entire genre of RPGs. The power of the Indie scene continues and we see this as all part of a bigger trend of bringing control back to the developers.
Supporting Wasteland 2 is nothing more radical than pre-ordering a game from your favorite brick-and-mortar store. We believe strongly enough in this project and in your desire to see it become a reality, that we decided to go ahead with this Kickstarter drive to fund it.
Nuts and bolts time.
We’re going back to the original and building from there. No first person shooter, we’re going top down so you get a tactical feel for the situation. And we’re not ditching the party play to turn it into some hack-and-slash bloodfest. It’s turn based, tactical, with a storyline that will be deeper and broader.
We’re determined to keep the gritty, grim and satirical writing. We’re going to pitch those moral dilemmas at you. You’re going to be faced with the consequences of your actions.
We’re planning on an initial 6 months of pre-production. We’ll nail down every important element that you, our creative partners, want.  Once we have all that figured out, we buckle down for 12 month development cycle. During that time, players can get a sneak peek on a private closed beta through Steam.  In addition, we will be giving you constant updates and showing you our progress along the way.
To do this game right, we need to raise $1 million, but you'll notice our funding request is $900,000 and that is because Brian Fargo has offered to fund the last $100,000 if need be. That’s a lot of money needed, but not when compared with the budgets of most full scale RPGs made today. The original game sold over 100,000 copies—on the Apple ][ and Commodore 64 platforms back in the day. If everyone who played it then backs the project at the most basic level, the game is on.

But we’re looking ahead to what we can do if you all back this project in force. At $1.25 million, the money will go primarily into making the world bigger, adding more maps, more divergent stories and even more music. 

At $1.5 million, the world gets even bigger. You’ll have more adventures to play, more challenges to deal with, and a greater level of complexity to the entire storyline.  We’ll add more environments, story elements, and characters to make the rich world come alive even more.  We will even be able to bring Wasteland 2 to OS X and Linux! And after $1.5 million the sky is the limit.
Everyone on the team is incredibly excited about the possibilities this Kickstarter will unlock. Like you, we’ve long dreamed of being able to bring Wasteland back.  If you share that dream, if you’ve always wanted to watch and influence the game design process from start to finish, this is your chance. If you’ve wanted to change the world and get the games you really deserve, then do it by funding this Kickstarter.  The road to Wasteland 2 is there. 
Join us on what’s going to be a wild ride.
***A big thank you to our (already) loyal forum users for their help in crafting the Kickstarter rewards.  You guys rock!**
